Reviews.Title: “Will never stay here again, spend your money elsewhere.”
Reviews.Author: angie c
Reviews.Content: Very poor customer service, understaffed on every level. The waterpark was understaffed on a holiday weekend, meaning one of their two slides were closed. When I needed to report a drain problem in our tub I waited 27 minutes at the front desk while she took birthday party reservations. When I asked for management regarding some of these matters, there was not one available. Remember I stated they were very understaffed, which means like it or not managers should of filled in for this busy holiday weekend. We had three towels placed in our room for our family of six reservation with two full beds and bunkbeds, waited hours for those after contacting front desk. Management was available at time of checkout and stated that being understaffed was out of their control and rattled on about pool safety policies and how housekeeping is usually very quick, she stated that no report was made about drain issue when it was reported the first day. Very rude and argumentative responses from her, I asked for a number for the hotel manager/owner & she refused to give me the number. Instead she handed me the main card and number, I asked for the day of the week I may be able to reach them seeing how in three days I couldn't get a manager at all she also refused that request. She stated there was not a point in speaking to them as they would agree with her handling of the situation. Later some locals told me the daughter of the owners runs the show which explains her behavior. It was a joke for a place pretending to be called a resort...

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous waterpark - "Motel 6/Super 8"-type rooms”
Reviews.Author: a_midwestern_family
Reviews.Content: Great waterpark, even for adults; whereas Splash Country is geared more toward elementary age kids. Chlorine levels seemed fine to us. Lifeguards walks the perimeter of the pools constantly so parents can relax. Be sure to have alternate plans if you visit, management may deny admission based on current waterpark occupancy #'s. We did not stay at the motel but asked to see a room. They are very average. Bunkbed areas are small and "plain jane". Our 10 yr. old said, "No thanks". Updated rooms and some cool kids graphics in the bunk areas would make this a great place to stay. As is, we'll continue to stay somewhere else and come play when we can.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok”
Reviews.Author: rebe19
Reviews.Content: Last year we were here in Branson and stayed at the Grand Country hotel with indoor waterpark. It was a great experience. Even said I would stay again. Well we came back this year and decided to try out something new. So we choose the Castle Rock. Well now I'm wishing we would have stayed with the first place. Reasons? 1 the shower in the room did not drain by the time you finished showering you were up past your ankles in your dirty bath water plus the person ahead of you.. 2 the pool hours sucked three of the days we stayed it was closed or didn't open early enough or stay open late enough we couldn't enjoy it. 3 it was higher priced than the other for less value. 4 they really don't have as much activities on the grounds as the other. By the end of the stay the kids were saying how much they wished we would have stayed somewhere else. Overall wouldn't stay here unless I had to. As far as recommending it :/ it would be my second choice.

Reviews.Title: “Back-to-School Get-away”
Reviews.Author: Liz7168
Reviews.Content: We stay here often and love the convenience of the water park. We were very disappointed during this stay. I could not believe the noise tolerance! Kids were running down the halls and making all kinds of noise well after midnight. We have two small children and understand that kids are sometimes noisy. But at midnight, SERIOUSLY? Most of the hotels we stay at have and enforce quiet hours between 10 pm and 6 am out of respect for those who are trying to sleep. We value sleep especially for our little ones and our sanity. Unless some changed are made, we will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Indoor Water Park, Average Hotel Room”
Reviews.Author: Hayton81
Reviews.Content: We stayed across from the main hotel in the "Atrium" section. The rooms were clean and well maintained. The higher cost for the hotel room is definitely for the water park, as the hotel rooms were just average. The water park was pretty nice, had lots of stuff for younger kids.

Reviews.Title: “Great water fun...stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: limeUsa
Reviews.Content: The waterpark was great fun for our 2 children under 10. I would give it a 4/5. There were lots of life guards and fun areas for them to swim. I would recommend getting a day pass and staying somewhere else. The hotel was a 2/5. The room was clean, but had old fashioned linens and smelled musty and damp when we arrived. We used an air freshener from the car (placed in the a/c) to freshen it up a bit. We purchased a weekend package that included pizza and drinks (value $25). When we went to redeem the pizza, they restaurant told us that they were out of cheese until much later in the evening. We asked the front desk employee if we could use the voucher for another food item or get credit on our room, as it was 5:15 pm and we were leaving the next morning. She told us neither was possible. She told us there would be cheese availble for the pizza, but couldn't tell us when. My husband asked to speak with the manager. She said he was away. We left our voucher there as she said she would check on options and call us. With two hungry swimmers in tow, we opted to go out for dinner. We went back a few hours later. We hadn't received any communcation regarding the voucher. The same front desk employee seemed clueless and said, "Here is your voucher. We have cheese now." It was 7:15. I gave the voucher to a family checking in with kids in hopes someone would get use from it. Of course, it isn't about the $25 meal as much as it is about the horrible service and lack of problem solving skills for THEIR mess up. Should a restaurant run out of cheese on Saturday evening? Probably not, but if they do, they should have other options available for something they have already sold. We have owned small businesses in the past and understand that hiccups are part of business, but as a service provider was their job to correct the problem and/or offer other options. They just seemed completely obtuse to the fact that we had hungry kids and were leaving the next morning and it was their mistake we couldn't use the voucher. That is so frustrating! Stay some place that smells good and has fluffy linens and swim for the day instead!

Reviews.Title: “Kids loved the water!”
Reviews.Author: tkaylewis
Reviews.Content: Desk personnel on Saturday night was less than friendly. Sunday staff was nice. Room was average and in need of updating. (Standard double) Ran out of hot water and the shower "squealed." Air conditioner ran great! Too pricey for what it was. The highlight, and the reason we chose Castle Rock, was the water park. Grandkids aged 3 and 4 had a blast! They spent hours in the water, in all of the pools, inside and out! I LOVED the fact that the lifeguards walked the areas constantly. They were never at a standstill. The Grill was filling and affordable, if not tasty. Sufficient for what we needed at the time.

Reviews.Title: “We had fun.”
Reviews.Author: Alesha19
Reviews.Content: I thought overall this was a very nice getaway. We have 5 and 3 year old boys and they loved it all. There were several good things and several not-so-good things I will list below. Good: -Our room (3333) was in the Tower and was a very nice room that was clean and spacious. It was a handicapped room so they might be why it was large, I am not certain. The bathroom was huge and we had a mini-fridge and a table. There was a sink in the bathroom and a vanity outside the bathroom with a large mirror, hair dryer, etc. The kids loved the bunk beds and we loved the king bed. I would not want to stay in the other building as it is quite a distance, especially in the winter. -They have a restaurant on-site with decent, reasonably priced food. This allowed us to not have to leave the park. It also has room service, though we did not use it. -The water park was lots of fun for my kids and we had fun, too. They have stuff inside and outside, and there were plenty of towels, life jackets, seats/tables. It was clean, too. There were three shallow kid pools and 2 deeper adult pools, a lazy river, and 2 slides. -They allow you to stay and play until close on the day you check out (10pm), and there is a shower in the restroom by the pools so you can clean up and head straight to your next destination (Dixie Stampede for us). -It's quite a bit cheaper than Great Wolf Lodge (but still expensive). -The A/C unit had a remote control. Very nice. Bad: -The wireless internet did not work in our room. -The lady at the desk was snippy with me when I told her the rate she was going to charge was not what was quoted to us on the phone just a few hours earlier (we booked the same day we stayed the night) but fixed it. -They charge you quite a bit of money for breakfast that is the same quality as the free ones at other places. Take doughnuts. -They were short on lifeguards so they could only have one slide open at a time on Saturday. This not only cut out on play time, but also made the other areas very crowded with people who would have been sliding. This also caused a shortage of tubes required for the one slide. -They were also short on help in the restaurant and it took a very very long time to get our food, even when we were the ONLY people in there. -It is really loud when they are cleaning the water park in the mornings when your room is right above it. -There was only one umbrella at one table outside. There were several tables but no umbrellas. -The palm tree "rain shower" was not working outside. I think we will go back. Overall we had a good time, especially for booking last minute. It would have been nice for others in our family to be able to get a day pass but they were over booked that weekend so they weren't able to. There is a spa I'd like to have tried but we didn't have the time. I can't say much about service because we didn't really require any. I do not know about the fitness center, either.

Reviews.Title: “Pros/Cons of this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ro R
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Tower (I recommend it), customer service -very friendly but it was too busy for just 1 employee, Waterpark - very clean and loads of fun for all ages, Rooms - very clean but plain and outdated, carpet - in great shape, very clean, like new. BEDS - awful! They were clean and soft sheets but the mattresses were awful! Hotel also had a hot water issue but this may have been a one time problem. We didn't enjoy the slightly warm to cold showers. In conclusion, this hotel needs to spend money on some good beds and I think they would see happier customers that would return.

Reviews.Title: “Whats seems to be on par for Branson.”
Reviews.Author: gtate20000
Reviews.Content: This hotel seems clean and fairly reasonable when it comes to price. Dont be misled you are paying for the watetpark amenity in the price of your stay. Its an indoor park so this is probably an awesome stay in the winter months. My teenager loved the slides. The rooms stand out as new carpet and sinks maybe new mattress but the rest is tired.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful family vacation”
Reviews.Author: Kera S
Reviews.Content: We took a family vacation for 4 days and 3 nights to Castle rock and had nothing else planned. I am so glad that we did not plan anything else because our kids who are 8 and 23 months loved every minute of the waterpark. We had snacks and breakfast from the hotel restaurant and were very pleased. The cheese fries were amazing and were plenty for our family to share. Drinks were very reasonable and we were able to have free refills all day. We rented a locker in the water park for 2 days at $6 a day. I know that there was plenty of variety in the water park to please kids and adults alike. My little one enjoyed 2 naps a day on the lazy river. I know that given the opportunity we will be visiting here again. The room was very clean and beds were very comfortable. Great service from every one involved. THANK YOU!!!

Reviews.Title: “Super Bad Trip”
Reviews.Author: jbhannon
Reviews.Content: We were not told upon reservation that our room would be in an old motel next door that they took over. The beds were horrible and the pillows were flat as pancakes. The water park lacked enough lifeguards and often found stuff floating in the pools.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for Families”
Reviews.Author: Janagrl
Reviews.Content: This was a Living Social coupon deal for 2 nights. We are a family of 4 with a 5 year old and a 22-month old. We stayed in a basic tower room - 2 double beds and a nook with a bunk bed and small TV for the kids. The room was very clean and the beds and pillows were very comfortable. We arrived at 12:45 pm (check in is at 4:00 pm), but had no problems checking in right away. The desk staff were not rude, but not friendly either. The comforters on the beds are really outdated, but who really cares?? - they were clean. The room had a fridge, but no microwave. I'm not sure why they don't provide a microwave since that is pretty standard in hotels these days. The water park was a lot of fun for our kids. The indoor water was kind of cold, but not unbearable. My kids enjoyed the outdoor kiddie pool. Yes, the chlorine was strong, but not obnoxious. I would much rather know that they are keeping the pools sanitary. My kids had no type of reaction from the chlorine. We had the nachos and pizza at the hotel restaurant and both were delicious! The staff in the restaurant were very nice. We had a good time and it is great for families with small children. My son would have been happy to do nothing else in Bransonbut play in the swim park! By the way, you could still enjoy a full day of other activities in Branson and have plenty of time at the hotel. The pool was open until 10:00 pm. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beware!”
Reviews.Author: Scott M
Reviews.Content: We wanted to take our 2 year old on her first trip and tried to choose something that would entertain her. This looked like it would fit the bill, as we would have the convenience of having our room close to our main source of entertainment. The first day we were there, one of the outdoor water items was not working and one of the indoor slides was shut down. Our room was called an Atrium room, why I do not know. It was basically an older hotel, possibly a bought out Best Western or Holiday Inn, which was painted the same color as the main Castlerock building. It had no atrium and was across two parking lots to the pool area. The building was old, the AC was loud, walls thin, toilet seat loose and toilet had to be flushed two or three times to empty bowl, had to pay extra for refridgerator and microwave combo (Microwave not big enough to accomodate bag of popcorn), television very old, furniture looked like it was original 1970 hotel and the sheets on the bed would not stay on the matress, oh and pillows very flat and old. The Lifeguards very young which would give them some excuse for their hospitality and attitude, however there was no excuse for the uncaring, rude and discourteous behavior of what they call Management. Apparently there is no skillset or training required to be a manager at this hotel. If you have a problem during your stay, trust that they could not care less. Way overpriced. Do yourself a HUGE favor and stay at a nicer, lower priced, reputable chain hotel and buy a pass to White water or another park. The kids will have a better time and you will not be as disappointed as we were with our vacation. I believe the only way this place is getting any good reviews, could be that it is getting them from owners, employees or someone paid to do so. The pool does not open until 10 or 10:15, whenever they feel like it, so don't think you will be able to swim the day of check out, not unless you want to change in a dirty public bathroom before your departure.Curtains do poor job of blocking out the light. Restaurant was nasty looking and always empty. TERRIBLE, STAY AWAY!

Reviews.Title: “Castle Rock Resort Waterpark-Good trip”
Reviews.Author: Adam W
Reviews.Content: I used a Living Social $199(3 days/ 2 nights + large pizza and 4 drinks) coupon for our weekend stay. I travel a ton for work and spend about 6-8 nights/ month in hotels. That being said I had very low expectations after reading the other reviews of this property. Since we have a family of 6 the rooms with the bunk beds(tower room) suited us well. We had no issue with cleanliness as previously posted by other reviewers. One of the sheets on the kids bunk had some "kid candy hand" marks on it and after asking for it to be changed it was quickly done. Our room was only cleaned once during our stay which was mainly a tidy up, bed straightening and re-stock towels, etc... Room was not vacuumed however I saw the HSK folks and they came and did it right after we spoke. I only have 2 minor issues. First, no microwave in standard rooms, this was an issue only because we have a 13 month old still drinking bottles. The folks at the restaurant gladly helped each time we nned to warm up a bottle. Second, water temps were pretty chilly. The lazy river temp was good but the slides, kiddie pools, and outdoor pools were all a bit cool for my kids. We would go back if we found another deal like the Living Social one we used for this trip.

Reviews.Title: “Had a Great time”
Reviews.Author: BBRestaurant
Reviews.Content: We went to Castle Rock and had a GREAT Time.. The place was very clean and the staff very very friendly. The lifeguards were very focused on their job. I watched the water being tested so you know that its safe. Highly Recommend this place if you have small children. its very kid friendly. The Lazy River was fun.

Reviews.Title: “small but very nice”
Reviews.Author: medicn8
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay here . Check in was a breeze. We had two seperate reservations due to a living social deal and they allowed us to stay in the one room without checking out and checking back in. We were also allowed to check in early. As far as the complaints of the strong chlorine smell in the pool area I did not experience it. Now I'm sure in the colder months it may be that way when no doors are opened up but what do u expect??? Life guards were seen waking around watching people nonstop and paying attention very well. Room was good sized, clean and well stocked.

Reviews.Title: “poop”
Reviews.Author: prhis
Reviews.Content: I wish I would have read these reviews before wasting my money. DIRTY ! When we pulled the couch out to prepare the bed for our kids to sleep in it, apparently it had not been changed. It was dirty , but we became disgusted when we noticed dirt chunks that appeared to be feces (YES POOP). We called the front desk and WE had to go down to get the new bedding. It was only about 10 and there was no one available to do that. The breakfast was one of the worst ever.First they opened late- only after we asked why it wasnt open and we waited about 30 minutes. I requested to order off menu rather than eat buffet and they really acted like they had no idea how to do that. In fact, they tried to talk me into the buffet. The buffet looked as if it had been in the trays a while. At check out the lady was unable to make any adjustments and gave me the managers phone number. I have made a dozen attempts to contact this man. One would think he would WANT to know if his facility was not operating effectively. HE obviously could care less, because he will not repond via email or anything. My last attempt to contact him I left another voicemail and stated I guess I would have to dispute charges with my ccard company. I will not recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “PIG STY!”
Reviews.Author: rnamy72
Reviews.Content: We checked into a clean room but this was the last we saw of house keeping except when we had to borrow towels from her cart. Arrived back after a day of site seeing to find the room exactly as we left it, same damp towels, trash cans full and the sink had never drained from the morning toothbrush routine. I had called the drain issue to the attention of the desk clerk but somehow it "slipped thru the cracks" The maintenance man shows up a few minutes later and plunged the sink with a toilet plunger that he carried in and out of room wrapped in a foul smelling plastic bag that left our room smelling awful. At this point, I totally lost it and went to the desk and asked if they expected us to use this sink after a toilet plunger had been used on it? The desk manager was nice and assured me that my room and the sink would be serviced. We headed out to the water park where the kids had a blast, but due to the overwhelming smell of chlorine, my 13 yr old was having chest pain and my 11 year old coughing continuously after a short period. When we arrived back to the room, we found the same mess we had left. I threw all our dirty linens out the door, along with the trash and went to get my own fresh towels from the desk. This place looked great on the website but is definitely overpriced with just downright disgusting housekeeping.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: wanttotravelalot
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Castle Rock because my sister wanted the waterpark. The room were clean enough. The staff was efficient and pleasant. My niece and nephew are 5 and 3 so the water park was fine for them. If your kids are over 12, they will get bored. The two waterslides are fun for a while. The lazy river is small and not very lazy. The current was stronger than I've ever experienced and may intimidate weak swimmers. The toddler area is good with several slides and waterfalls to play in. Sorry grown-ups, no hot tub for you. My sister stayed in the family suite which is really just one big room with a mini-fridge, microwave and sink. It had the bunkbeds in a oversized closet with a tv. I got one the atruim rooms. Not realizing they are actually next door to the waterpark. They bought a "Days Inn" type motel. So nothing fancy, just a basic hotel room with exterior doors. To upgrade to the tower room was another $50/night. Not worth it to us. Luckily the weather was warm enough so this wasn't a problem walking across the parking lot. During the summer months, I can't see any reason to pay the extra money for the waterpark. Just spend the day at White Water. And even in the winter, just stay one night that will give you two days in the waterpark and then move to another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Stay Ever!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sis b
Reviews.Content: I had booked this hotel with waterpark two months in advance for my daughter's 6th birthday. We arrived at 3:45 for check-in. I was told room was not ready so I waited. At 4:00 staff gave me waterpark braclets but did not want to swim before bday party so waited. Did not get room until 5pm because was not ready. I had six kids crazy for party and swimming. Went to room and it was filthy!! I had waited for them to get it ready and looked like they had walked in and out. The bedsheets looked used and the bathroom was awful. After the party we went swimming and none of the kids could enjoy themselves because the smell of chlorine was so bad. All of them kept coughing and running to the open door for air. I will NEVER stay at castlerock branson again. My daughter's 6th bday was suppose to be fun but I'm sure she will remember the time she stayed at a hotel and couldn't breathe. Would not recommended anyone thinking of going!! The staff could care less if you need anything or had trouble with room. Worse managing of a hotel I have ever seen!!

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN!”
Reviews.Author: Sarah J
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night with my two children during Spring Break. We arrived at check in time (4:00) to utter chaos! After waiting 30 minutes in the crowded lobby we were told that they didn't have clean rooms available. We waited four hours to get into a room. The hotel staff didn't offer any sort of comp for our wait and seemed to blame us for the issue. The rooms are outdated, the bed linens smelled like grease - they must have been washed with linens from the restaurant, and the bathtub wasn't clean. The water park is nice, but we have stayed at Grand Country is the past and there aren't many differences between the two. I would recommend buying a day pass for the water park and staying at a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute filthiest and worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: Divemistresskristie
Reviews.Content: Check in took over two hours. They offered the guest the Service of late check out due to the rain. Two days later we asked about the late service check out and staff informed us they had not done that in months. I know for a fact they did it that Wednesday. We were told they had just changed the policy when the hotel was booked to capacity. Room was filthy. Clon of hair in the bath tub. Pubic hair on the toilet. We paid an extra $10 to have a refrigerator and microwave brought in. We requested that it be turned on so it would be cold when we arrived. It wasn't even plugged in. There were no hand towels and we had to go get out own bath towels from the maid cart. Indoor waterpark chlorine content will choke you. Kids could not hardly stand their eyes burning so badly. I could Bartley breathe in their. I had to sit next to a window that was propped open. There was an accident in the pool and staff were not having children get out of the pool for it to be cleaned. This hotel does not card about its guest and only care about their money. Go to grand country to have indoor swimming.

Reviews.Title: “Kids loved it”
Reviews.Author: Pie424
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Branson and since our time was limited our family vacation had to be a short one. I was worried after taking our 2 boys (both 8 yrs old) here after DisneyWorld last year they wouldnt enjoy themselves. However the rooms were not to bad and they enjoyed having the waterpark attached right to the hotel. So we were able to get them to do other things during the day and could come back to the hotel and swim. The waterpark had 2 slides and a lazy river. Enough to keep them busy. I would definitely come and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great fun!”
Reviews.Author: DM778
Reviews.Content: We took our 3 year old son here for a fun getaway. And that is what we got! The waterpark was very clean and great for all ages! Rooms were also very clean with a kids nook(bunk beds and tv). Made him feel special! Loved the arcade as well. Staff was very curtious and always did what they could to make our stay fun. Would highly recommend for a fun getaway. We are hoping to make this an annual trip!

Reviews.Title: “Branson Rookie”
Reviews.Author: MisplacedNYer
Reviews.Content: This was our families first visit to Branson, Mo and found the town and all it's ammenities to be above average. The hotel and waterpark was clean and overall my 3 kids(15,12,10) enjoyed themselves. It is still off season so not alot going on but did overhear the hotel manager say that the hotel was full for the weekend(Presidents Day) That says alot to the type of "resort" this is and services were good. The Tower Grill is ok if you want a quick bite, but there are so many restraunts in town that we skipped it. Overall this is a very good hotel with a decent indoor waterpark............it is no Great Wolf Lodge but for the price and location very respectable! Close to everything and affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service”
Reviews.Author: Bullfrog270
Reviews.Content: I really enjoy going to Branson with my family & have stayed at numerous hotels. This is about the only truly negative experience with a hotel I have had there. We had to leave early due to an illness on an earlier trip. The hotel gave us a certificate to use for a future stay in lieu of not billing the remainder of stay that we didn't use. I am now having a very hard time getting them to honor the certificate. This is something we have paid full price for and hotel management is completely unwilling to allow us to redeem. Grand Country will definitely get our business.

Reviews.Title: “Annual indoor waterpark weekend Jan 2012”
Reviews.Author: GoGirlStL
Reviews.Content: Bought LivingSocial deal for 2 nights, unlimited waterpark access, and one pizza 4 drinks for $199. Check in quick and easy. Room clean and spacious with kids having own bunks and TV. Called 3 wks ahead to have micro and fridge in room. They have limited supplies and if they run out before they get to you, too bad. Biggest issue is the level of chlorine in the waterpark. We have a pool so I am knowledgable of chemicals and levels, My sons and I had to leave several times during our stay due to difficulty breathing. One night it was so severe that every single person was coughing severely. When the problem was brought to the attention of staff, they admitted that they have had to close the resort due to inappropriate levels of chlorine causing staff to get severely ill. Restaurant is more like a snack bar but no complaints. The waterpark is no comparison to Great Wolf, Coco Key, or Valley of the Springs.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome mid winter getaway with the kids!”
Reviews.Author: randynlisa123
Reviews.Content: Took our 4 kids ( 4, 17,18,27) for a weekend getaway to celebrate Dads birthday in January. Of course the 4 yr old had the time of her life but the older kids had lots of fun too. The lazy river here isn't as "lazy"as some which makes it so much better!. The lifeguards were doing an amazing job at keeping their eye on everything while not being so strict that the kids couldn't still have fun. We stayed in a tower room so that all we had to do was ride the elevator down to the waterpark (GREAT idea I read from a previous review). Our room was clean , spacious, and everything was in good working order. Yes, you could hear kids in the hallway when they were going to and from the waterpark, but this IS an exciting place for kids and we didn't hear any noise after bedtime. The on-site restaurant was affordable, the food was good, and the portions were generous. The staff was friendly and helpful. There is also a small game room and a gift shop where you can pick up a souvenir or a swim suit if you forgot one ;). If your not interested in all the shows that Branson has to offer then January is a great time to go, as almost all of them are closed for the season, and you can enjoy a stress free, CROWD free relaxing time.

Reviews.Title: “Had a Pretty Good Time!”
Reviews.Author: jefffou
Reviews.Content: We just got back home yesterday and had a good time at the Castle Rock. The rooms were clean, as were the beds and bathrooms. Nothing special, but tidy and fresh - no complaints here at all. The room we had contained two standard beds and a loft bunk bedroom near the main room. We have three children and were able to get all of us in, and asleep comfortably. The pool area was good, but quite a bit smaller than the Great Wolf Lodge in K.C. So, don't expect it to be on par with that. It had a couple of slides - one slower one for smaller children and an enclosed one which was fairly fast. Nice lazy river experience and various other pools of water for smaller children, and larger ones for basketball - if that's your thing. If you've ever been to a Great Wolf Lodge, then you get the idea of the active lifeguards, walking all over the water park, searching for kids in trouble. This part, I like a lot. It makes us feel more secure knowing that the associates are doing their best to look for drowning children. Overall, I liked the place. Not huge, but clean. I would recommend the place, especially at the price we paid - $150 taxes and everything for one night.

Reviews.Title: “Indoor Waterpark for the Winter”
Reviews.Author: Trout-Tuff
Reviews.Content: Decided to get out of town at the last minute for New Year's Eve. Wanted somewhere where the kids could swim, so we needed something with an indoor pool. Found this indoor water park at Castle Rock Resort in Branson and thought that would fit our family perfectly. I was referred to this location thru Branson Tourism which was able to find an opening at the last minute. To check in you must use the office in the Castle Rock Resort main building. The indoor water park is inside the Castle Rock Resort, but apparently they also own the two older hotel buildings to the north which is called, Atrium. This is actually where we got booked. Building 1 sits 100 feet away with a parking lot access road between and building 2 is another 300 feet north separated by a large parking lot. It wasn't too inconvenient since the weather turned out to be pretty nice for the end of December to run between the buildings, but if the weather was worse it would have been a pain. The Atrium Hotel is a much older facility. All rooms have outside doors. The beds where old and very bouncy. The lighting was dim and dated. The rooms smelled clean and were overall clean in appearance. The shower head is very low for any adult, but did have good water pressure and plenty of hot water. It had a soap dispenser in the shower that was empty. The rooms in the Atrium are definitely budget feeling, I would recommended staying in the main building if possible, I didn't view any of those rooms, but they are definitely newer so that should be a plus. I would stay again in the Atrium if I had to, but I would try everything possible to avoid it. The water park turned out to be a huge hit for my 2 girls ages 12 and 10. They have a couple large kiddy pool areas, 1 wading pool, 2 large twist and turn slides, and a lazy river that actually moves pretty quick. The kids loved the water park and my wife and I enjoyed it as well. The water park is very clean and the lifeguard staff was very professional in nature and constantly on their feet scanning the different areas they were assigned. I was very impressed with the whole water park facility. I would use the water park facility again!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for the kids”
Reviews.Author: DebNRidgeville_Ohio
Reviews.Content: We are on a holiday vacation with our grandchildren in Branson. I wanted to write a review about Castle Rock resort. We stayed yesterday on Christmas eve and the kids really enjoyed themselves. The resort is small enough yet just the right size for a day of water fun. The kids are 13,9 and 6 and it was just what the doctor ordered after 2 days of travel. We found the room to be clean and the waterpark maintained well. Lifeguards were very actively involved and were very conscious of the kids, which I really appreciated. All in all , a nice stay...staff were very friendly and always willing to help you.

Reviews.Title: “YUCK”
Reviews.Author: Williar11
Reviews.Content: We rented 2 rooms this past weekend, since we took our kids and granddaughters to Branson for the weekend. The granddaughters loved the water park! The restaurant was ok, the staff was real nice. The rooms were horrible! The bathroom hadn't been cleaned from the last customers: used soap & shampoo in the shower and hair in the bed. The sheets had holes in them from wear. The topper though was the bugs that were in the picture frames! Dead bugs!!! I am not talking just 1 bug, in our room our 2 picture frames had 5 dead bugs in 1 and 3 in the other. In our son and daughter in laws room they had 6 bugs in 1 of their picture frames. I have pictures, but unsure on how to upload them on the website.

Reviews.Title: “Experience depends on the age of your kids, Definitely some room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: With5KidsInTow
Reviews.Content: OK, it's no Great Wolf Lodge, let's start with that. Kind of like if you take your kids to Disney then expect them to love the local amusement park. Not gonna happen. That said, my 1 and 3 year olds LOVED it! My 8 and 10 year olds liked it, my 12 year old (who still loves Great Wolf) really didn't enjoy it at all. Pros-an awesome Lazy River, better than any we'd ever seen, really helpful with the early check-ins, clean enough, decent sale rates, also, for larger families, it's actually a pretty good deal-we have 5 kids, with 2 doubles and 2 bunks, we were OK and didn't have to splurge for an extra room Cons-no hot tub---WHAT!!! it's a water park where parents are obviously going to be in the water-how can there be no hot tub???, no wave pool, no large water-playground, cool water, and just-OK slides. Really not enough to justify the expense with older kids. Again, no hot tub...I'm having trouble getting past that. No workout room, beds are doubles, not queens, and finally, not enough luggage carts. Would I stay there again...on a good deal, sure. That said, I don't think I'd figure my older kids for more than 2 hours or so at the waterpark.

Reviews.Title: “Thin walls...but property is fine”
Reviews.Author: Mary F
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a cheer competition this weekend. While I cannot speak for the buildings outside of the main building, I did not have many problems with the room. The only issue I had was that you could hear children running, but other then that it was okay. My girls enjoyed it and the waterpark was sufficient. I cannot speak negatively as others have. My suggestion would be to stay in the main building and you will be okay... ***Be aware that the traffic on the strip is REDICULOUS*****

Reviews.Title: “So-So Experience”
Reviews.Author: carpsonthego
Reviews.Content: Our experience here was mixed. We stayed Nov 4-6 and overall it was ok. We stayed in the Atrium Tower which is across the parking lot from the main building. It seemed to us that these buildings were once an independent hotel which was bought out by Castle Rock, fixed up on the outside and used for additional rooms. We booked over the internet and got a rate of $61 plus additional cost for water park access. With hotel tax we ended up with a total of $100 a night. When we arrived to check in the man at the front desk got us right in. I couldn't help but notice his coworker at the front desk was so rude and seemed to go out of her way to not help those needing assistance. I thought to myself thank goodness I got the good one that was helpful. He explained the rules of the hotel and the water park access. Our room was a 1 minute walk from the main building. The room was average, clean with the beds (uncomfortable), carpet and bathroom worn out. A couple of the cable channels were fuzzy and the wireless connection had inconsistant signal strength and connectivity. The water park itself was nice and our son had a great time. We did not eat in the restaurant but it appeared to have plenty of business. They advertised $5.99 buffet which seemed really reasonable for Branson. Overall our experience was ok and we would probably stay here again since the price was so reasonable and we have realistic expectations for the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: Jason K
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Castle Rock September 29 - October 2, first, we will NEVER stay there again. The reason for booking the reservation was for the waterpark. Before reserving the room, I contacted Castle Rock by phone and advised I was staying three nights and would only use the waterpark one day and asked if a one day pass could be purchased. The employee informed we could purchase a one day pass and informed me to book online only requesting room only, so I did. We arrived at approximately 1100 PM that night and asked the employee how to purchase a one day pass. The employee informed me I could not purchase a one day pass, due to me staying at the hotel. I explained to employee I was not using the waterpark except for one day. She refused to give a one day pass. The next day I contacted another employee and explained my situation again. The employee informed me she would have to upgrade my rooms in order for me to get access to the waterpark ($50 a night). After reading there website, it stated a one day pass could be purchased for $15 a person. After pointing it out to management, they informed my wife that was a mis print and immediately changed their website and still refused to give a waterpark pass. The outside billboard even states a one day waterpark pass can be purchased. It does not say by whom, just says a one day waterpark package can be purchased. Will never stay here again. A manager informed my wife the room only rate was only avaliable during the months of September and October. I was able to book a reservation for May 2012 room only. Hotel does not care about their guest.

Reviews.Title: “Overnight Birthday get-a-way”
Reviews.Author: pmo397
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at Castle Rock for my grand-daughters 9th Birthday. We were in the Tower building, 3 adults and 3 kids, age 2-12 yrs. old. From the moment we walked through the door, the staff was polite and very informational. Our room was on the 3rd floor with the kids cubby. All three kids loved the bunk beds and they had their own TV. The room was spacious enough for our group. The water park was set up for infants all the way to adults. The way out slides were awesome, not only did the older kids liked but the older generation enjoyed too. They have grill that serves breakfast,lunch and dinner for a reasonable price. It is conveniently located near the pool. The kids loved that. We ordered a 16" Supreme pizza and it was better than we expected it to be. MOst of the items on the kids menu was $3.99 and $5.99-7.99 on the regular menus. Pizza's also varied by size and toppings. We usually stay at the other indoor water park in Branson but that will be a thing of the past. It cost a little more but it is sooooo much better. The oldest has alread put her request in to stay there for her birthday in January. So we will definitely be returning.

Reviews.Title: “What you pay, isn't what you get...”
Reviews.Author: lil_motrips
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed @ this resort about a week ago. Pulling up it has the apperance of a 5 star resort but once we got to our room (which was in a building adjacent to main building) the rooms were average. The tv was outdated, the only movie channel looked too fuzzy to even try and watch, the beds didn't have fitted sheets, no shampoo/body wash in the dispenser (located in the shower), coffee maker with no pot and the waterpark was not for guests only. Now this doesn't bother me but we could have stayed @ a hotel for way less money then spent only $15 to play @ the waterpark! To me if I pay almost $170 a night there should be that level of awe and exclusivity. There was NO free breakfast but you could purchase a breakfast buffet for an additional $5.99 per person. I would not stay here again but we live and learn.

Reviews.Title: “was great fun for whole family!”
Reviews.Author: ccampbell615
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the tower which from reading the reviews may be the difference. It is super clean, looks new, plush carpet, soft beds, and the mattresses on the bunk beds are very thick( I don't know if they got new ones or what but my kids are fine with it) The water park was all in working order. The water in the lazy river is not dirty the bottom is painted to look like a river so it is dark brown/green which makes it look this way if the other people that said it was dirty had bothered to check they would have seen this... the water is also salt water the only place I found chlorine was in the outside pools and it did not seem very strong there. It was very warm in the indoor part but it is Aug. My only complaint is the fact that the water park does not open in the mornings during the week until 1 pm which means that even though you can swim the next day you will have to check out at 11 and come back at 1 or just not use your second day and it closes at 8 which means you only have 4 hours the night before from check in time till closing. when you pay on average 50 dollars more a night for the water park, then a regular hotel you would expect to get to use the water park more then that. I do wish the restaurant was open or they offered a breakfast but over all no big deal. I did notice the wallpaper peeling downstairs which makes it look cheap and run down. But the lady at check in was very nice as were the lifeguards. I would stay here again, although, we may try the grand country inn next time because its much cheaper and for the amount of time you get to use the water its not really worth it.

Reviews.Title: “I will never stay there again”
Reviews.Author: churchldy
Reviews.Content: When we arrived the rude staff would not accept the paperwork that the travel service had sent us. Check in took a good 10 minutes to accomplish. When we finally were given a room, we were very disappointed. The carpet had holes in it, the faucet not only dripped but poured when it was "turned off". The toilet was not attached to the floor and there was a hole in the wall in the bathroom. The beds were very old and the pillows were flat. It is a shame that all of this took place because my grandson really enjoyed the waterpark. Since there are other options for giving him the same experience, I will go elsewhere to stay.

Reviews.Title: “LISTEN TO THE REVIEWS!!!”
Reviews.Author: jen2838
Reviews.Content: .....because we didn't!!! This place is NASTY and not well maintained AT ALL. Our room had major plumbing problems (toilet overflowed all over the floor and sink almost overflowed just washing your hands....gross). I have no idea how this place will survive in a struggling economy....because their customer service is lacking as well. The manager was rude and so was one of the ladies at the check-in desk (although one of them was super nice and apologetic). I WILL NEVER STAY HERE AGAIN. YUCK!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: grandmaDover_AR
Reviews.Content: This was a nice place to stay. We spent one night. We got there early and the checked us right in. Grandkids 7 and 4 year olds loved the water park. We picked this so they could play and not be out in the sun. Older children might not find the water park very exciting. The breakfast buffet that you can purchase in the motel is as good as the ones at any of the other places and price was compartable to other places. I would diffinently stay there again. Would be a great place in the winter for kids to enjoy a water park.

Reviews.Title: “Read reviews from former guests prior to visiting Castle Rock Resort.”
Reviews.Author: Gspavk
Reviews.Content: Over priced for the value. The beds in the tower were of poor quality and the pillows were flat. The front desk person told us our check in time was at 2:00 and our room was not ready until 4:00 pm. We chose to stay at Castle Rock for the water park. Unfortunately, our three children were unable to enjoy the park due to the intense burning of the eyes from the chlorine in the air. This was highly disappointing. To top off the dissatisfaction, the cleaning lady used inappropriate language in Spanish as she passed us in the hallway. I would never recommend this so called resort to anyone. There is far better value and quality in Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Waterpark & Rooms Great - Restaurant & Staff Less than Average”
Reviews.Author: GrandsontoJoyces
Reviews.Content: I vacationed with daughter & four grandchildren (ages 4 to 10) and we all enjoyed the waterpark . Our room, with the bunkbed feature, was great. The front desk staff were beyond friendly, very accomodating and great with children. However, the onsite restaurant left a lot to be desired. The personnel were less than friendly to adults and children. No smiles or responses to a friendly "good morning". Breakfast cereal was generic - no fresh fruit only canned. I think a facility that caters to children with a waterpark and outside water fun would want only kid-friendly staff. If you want the best & most for your hard earned money go elsewhere to eat. Grill staff not guest friendly..

Reviews.Title: “Would NEVER recommend!”
Reviews.Author: straitforward
Reviews.Content: We stay the weekend of Friday July 15, we had got their" Summer Package" which we were told when booking over the phone, it included 2 nights, weekend passes to water park, Lg pizza and 4 drinks,and 4 tickets to IMAX for $432 after taxes... Was not told anything about the tickets being limited to non 3D documentary films only! Upon arrival the front desk clerk was very short and snippy with me, gave me our room key and wrist bands for the water park and said "that's it". When we got to our room the bathtub was dirty and our sheets had many spots where bleach had ate though them. There was no information in the room about the hotel and no Do Not Disturb sign. Late that night I got a blanket out of the closet area and started to spread it on the bed when I noticed it had vomit on it. I took the sheets and blanket to the front desk to get new ones and the so called new clean blanket was full of hair. The next morning I requested at the front desk for no one to be in my room and left for the day, needless to say housekeeping went in my room without us there. Then to end our stay I asked for the name of the GM, the woman who was working Friday and Sunday explain she was one of the owners. I told her about the problems over the weekend, she said she was sorry but there was nothing she could do but talk to Housekeeping. So I guess it was "Sorry for your bad luck". This hotel was NOT worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “Waterpark was great for our 4 year old, but the hotel is lacking”
Reviews.Author: blondie6224
Reviews.Content: We had never been to Branson before, but have stayed at an indoor waterpark before, and my son loves them, so we picked here because we heard it was newer than the other one in town. We booked the summer package that offered a free pizza and IMAX tickets, they failed to mention it was only for the adventure films, and a pool toy, which was a squirt gun thing I could have paid $1 for at any store. The food was horrible, like they were serving a high school cafeteria, but was priced well for what it was. The waterpark was great for my youngster, but older kids would have been very dissapointed. The rooms were the worst. I don't think I have stayed in a worse room, except maybe by accident while driving and just pulled over on the side of the interstate somewhere. The beds were old, and mattresses worn out, the showerhead was too low (and I'm short) and the water was cold out of it because it was a water-saver and didn't have enough pressure to make the hot water reach to the bottom of the tub. For the prices they charged, I would never stay again, I might just spend the $15 for the day pass to the waterpark.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of Fun”
Reviews.Author: jacknjillplus3
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at this hotel over the 4th of July weekend. We all had a great time. My kids didn't want to leave the waterpark and neither did i. The cooked hamburgers outside by the pool and we had lunch and barely got out of the pool. The lifeguards did a great job. My daughter really liked the games they played in the afternoon. Our room was fine, nothing fancy, but just what they said it was online. We will probably stay in the hotel attached to the waterpark next time just to make it easier.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: CouchTater
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 days booking a family suite and a regular room. The rooms were way over priced for what were typical motel rooms. Beds were old and uncomfortable, rooms were not clean. Requested twice maintenance for a faulty toilet and never got service. Staff were not very pleasant.Wireless internet service was slow when you could connect which was intermittent. The grandkids enjoyed the modest water park but not worth the extra price. This was my first trip to Branson and I can't say I saw any reason to return. Traffic was horrible, the people in the businesses and restaurants were not friendly and service was awful everywhere we went.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was exactly what we needed!”
Reviews.Author: RanchW
Reviews.Content: My family needed a getaway from much of the tragedy that has happened here lately, so after a very long search through what seemed like hundreds of hotels in Branson, we reluctantly chose this hotel after reading many reviews, good and bad. We chose this hotel due to the size of the waterpark and the bunk beds in the rooms and we were overall, very pleased with our stay! The waterpark is much newer and nicer than the other indoor waterpark in Branson. Our kids played in the waterpark for hours, saving us tons of money that we would have spent on other activities or attractions. The rooms were very spacious and clean, and the staff were all very friendly. I will be recommending this resort to all of my friends and family!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: wanjoy56
Reviews.Content: best lifeguards I've ever seen! I felt completely safe with my grandkids there. The people working there are so friendly and helpful. The food was great and reasonably priced. We were disappointed with Silver Dollar City and wished we'd played in the water park instead! My grandkids are still talking about what fun they had there. I wish we had one of these hotels and waterparks in Arkansas! We will be back. The room was awesome. The kids loved the bunk beds.

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience in branson!!!”
Reviews.Author: abridg77
Reviews.Content: The reason we picked this hotel was the indoor waterpark and the kids were so excited about the bunkbeds, big mistake!!!! The waterpark was not what we expected and the rooms certainly weren't either. Nothing was as it was described on their website and the rooms were way too expensive for what we got. The bunkbeds were awful!!! Kids deserve to be comfortable too, the beds were as hard as a rock! My daughter got up during the night and tried sleeping in the floor. Finally, around 12:00 I went down to the front desk and got another room so we could all sleep comfortably. As soon as we got up, we demanded cancelation on our rooms and we went to another hotel and was able to get a good nights sleep. Please, don't waste your money, if you want an indoor waterpark, go to Grand country inn. It might not have the fanciest rooms, but the waterpark is much nicer and the rooms are comfortable and clean.

Reviews.Title: “WOULD NEVER COME BACK!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: SSMST4
Reviews.Content: This was NOT a wonderful vacation spot at all. If I only would have been smart enough to come and read all of the reviews before booking the trip..... So sad that I had to waste one nights money on this place. I'm glad that we got the second night refunded to us, THE ONLY GOOD THING ABOUT THE PLACE...... If I were you, I would go down the street to Comfort In as it ROCKS!!!!!!!! It's cheaper and ALL of the workers are outstanding.... I would not take my dog back to this facility. It is very dirty, and watch out, they have HBO in the kids bunk area NOT A GOOD IDEA for 8 and 5 year olds......

Reviews.Title: “not as family freindly as they advertise!!”
Reviews.Author: bzymom3
Reviews.Content: *Hotel is not worth staying just buy the "day pass"! *no hot tub (and its a"waterpark" ) *changing rooms are not family friendly *waterpark on a small scale

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: sllsmiley1
Reviews.Content: We are currently staying at this "resort". We are highly disappointed with this establishment. The rooms were discounted for a class my husband is attending here. There was no mention of several things that would not be available due to the discount. When we arrived we were told we would not be allowed to swim unless we paid another $30 per day. The refridgerator is also an extra $10 a night! The room is dirty! We had no liner in the ice bucket, but plenty of hair. Every corner is dirty and the coffee maker actually has dust on it. Housekeeping barged in the room while my daughter was taking her afternoon nap! She said, "You are down to check out today." We are not scheduled to check out until Tuesday. 35 minutes after that another staff member came beating on the door about the broken coffee maker, again waking my daughter. The coffee maker works, there is actually a short in the outlet so it has to be wiggled to get it to work. There is no DO NOT DISTURB SIGN, so I could not place one on the door. I would get a better nights sleep on the sidewalk. Internet does not work! AWFUL PLACE!!

Reviews.Title: “Every thing is right there, you never have to leave. Cleanest place we have stayed!!!!”
Reviews.Author: hendrix_11
Reviews.Content: We had our 10 year old and 5 year old grandsons and they both had a blast. If you stay in the tower building you do not have to go outside to get to the water park. you can get anything you want to eat without leaving the building. The water park was fun for all ages. The lifguards patrol non-stop which is a good feeling.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment!!!”
Reviews.Author: thinmint66
Reviews.Content: I live in Branson and decided to book the family suite (in the Tower) for my daughter's birthday. My husband checked in first. The first room had toothpaste stains on the bathroom mirror and urine stains on the toilet , so we were moved. I'm not sure the second room was better. The door handle to the bathroom was broken and the towel bar broke off the wall simply by hanging a towel up. There were stains on the bed sheets. There was crumbled chips, popcorn, and loose change all over the floor and even in the bunkbeds. Found a pair of dirty underwear in the drawer and a dirty sock in the hide-a-bed. My husband was so sickened by this room, he left and went home. The manager's response to these complaints was "We are fixing everything that is coming to my attention." Really??? It shouldn't be like this in the first place. I'm not sure they own a vacuum. On the other hand, the waterpark was fun. Had 4 teenagers and an 8 yr old and we all enjoyed ourselves there but the hotel itself is much to desired. It was filthy and way too overpriced considering the ONLY amenity is the waterpark.

Reviews.Title: “The very worst customer service and Hotel experience in my life.”
Reviews.Author: ndntravel
Reviews.Content: The 2 things you have to get right in the Hotel business is Good customer service and a good bed. Castle Rock fails miserably in both areas. My family and i booked a 4 night stay over the Thanksgiving Holiday. BIG MISTAKE!!!! The rooms and beds are not acceptable on any level. When I went downstairs to check out the man at the desk said that he knew the beds were bad and that he would change me to a room that had new beds. I went and checked out the other room only to find it was as bad if not worse than the previous room. He had told me that if it was not acceptable he would cancel my reservation and return my money. When i returned he said that i would have to speak with the manager. She arrived and was defensive and condescending stating that they require a 24 hour notice to cancel a room. I asked how I was to know that the beds were unacceptable without sleeping in one first. She said that since I was not satisfied and would not stay there again, why would she refund or allow the credit? She mocked me when I told her that I had 250 employees and would not recommend Castle Rock to any of my employees. This is a poor choice for a family stay. The Splash Mountain Resort for an indoor pool is a much better choice.It is older but the staff is much more helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay at Castlerock Waterpark and Resort!”
Reviews.Author: twinbrown
Reviews.Content: We came to Branson for a few days of relaxation and we got it! The waterpark was lots of fun, the kids really enjoyed it! The hotel room was very nice for the price, the beds were very comfortable. My younger children enjoyed the extra nook with the bunkbeds and having their own TV. Our family will definately come again and we would recommend Castlerock to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the mini vacation!!!”
Reviews.Author: Hogfan99
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful time at Castle Rock. The rooms are spacious and clean. The employees were very helpful and courteous. I would recommend this to anyone. Even though my kids are teenagers, they enjoyed the water park. Restaurant food was very good. I will be coming back soon. Thanks Castle Rock!

Reviews.Title: “Do not spend the money!”
Reviews.Author: Blondie1948_10
Reviews.Content: I have traveled Branson since for I was a small child with my parents. Since I have been married 31 yrs. we took our college age daugh and friend and decided to try a Castle Rock. I have never booked a place and and some problems. I was placed on old 3 times.....had to repeat what type of room I wanted. I asked the gentleman if the price I saw on the internet was what I would pay he said that I would. Then we travel 3.5 hrs. and arrive late and they give me a room of not what I asked for. Then when I told them what I had requested they raised the price another $50.00 per nite. Well, once they have your credit card number you can't exactly leave. Then the waterpark was kinda lame. The water on the lazy river was dirty. The kids both had bites once they got out of the water. The beds were hard and squeaked. The toilet holder came off the wall. I reported that to the front desk immediately as I didn't want to be blamed for that. The price was too high. Plus, it didn't have a breakfast. I think I will just stay at the normal everyday mom and pop places. I will not return there at all. I would suggest to stay somewhere less expensive and use the money for fun stuff.

Reviews.Title: “Visit the indoor water park but Sleep somewhere else.”
Reviews.Author: Delnlee
Reviews.Content: We have a 2 and 4 yr old and came for the indoor park. The park was good and the kids had fun. Thats where it ends. The rooms were filthy. A slab of plywood would have had more cushion than the beds. There is zero insulation so you can hear everything 3 rooms away. They have the right idea like the kids cuby bunks but then they go cheap on the mattress and apparently have completly done away with vacuum cleaners. The rates (166 per night after tax) were no indication of how bad it would be. When I mentioned how bad it was at the front desk at checkout the guy just acted like it was the norm as if people complain all the time. They don't care.Not only will I not recommend this to a friend I will very loudly recommend they NOT waste thier money here.

Reviews.Title: “CASTLE ROCK IS DIRTY AND A WASTE OF MONEY”
Reviews.Author: mandy070
Reviews.Content: We choose this hotel because of the indoor water park since we were traveling with 4 children ages 6-12. We reserved two atrium rooms for our party of 8. Upon arrival, we found the atrium rooms to be filthy!! In both rooms, we found some foreign objects in the bed sheets. There were dead bugs in the window sills and on the floor and overall the room was not clean. We reported this to the front desk, and they moved us to the tower rooms. They did NOT offer to move us to the tower room for the same price as the atrium room and were not willing to give a discount. The atrium rooms are $99 and the tower rooms are $149. Since it was already 4pm and we were only staying for one night, we decided to go ahead and move rather than find another hotel. The tower rooms were cleaner and we did not find any foreign objects or bugs but we were anxious to get out the next morning. We will never stay here again. This hotel was a waste of money.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay again”
Reviews.Author: stcoupey
Reviews.Content: Luckily our stay there was much better than most of the others who left reviews. We had an awesome room (2235) with a kid’s cove and a view of the indoor water park. The only complaint I had with the room is that yes, the beds are very firm, and the mattresses on the bunk beds were extremely thin. Other than that, the room was very clean, updated and spacious. The indoor water park was the best part. We have a 12, 8, 4, and 2 year old, and they all loved it, and spent hours upon hours in there. The lifeguards were very attentive, and I would have felt safe leaving my 8 and 12-year-old there by themselves. All the staff members were very courteous and helpful. The only other complaint I had is with the breakfast buffet at the Tower Grill. It cost $5.99/adult and $3.99/kid, and had a limited buffet--they didn't even have bacon available with the buffet. I also question the safety of their milk and juices, which were just set out on the counter instead of in an ice bath. Overall, I would stay again, and was pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and understaffed....”
Reviews.Author: RavenHensley
Reviews.Content: Our family decided to try this hotel on a whim and we regretted it. The worst part of the stay was the fact that the rooms were not clean. We checked in to the first room and our daughter who is 8 months old found "something" under the bed skirt and put it immediately in her mouth. We went immediately down to the front desk and demanded another room. We looked over the second room closely before we let the baby loose and there were a lot of crumbs, bits of Doritos, and other things all around under the bed skirt and under and behind the night table. It is obvious that they do not clean well. Also there were horrible finger prints all over the light switches and the lamp between the beds. It looked like someone had tried to turn off the light with peanut butter all over their fingers. The beds weren't bad but the sheet in the "kid cave" came off and we had to re-make the bed. Worst of all, the older lady at the front desk was very snarky and rude when we discussed these matters with her. She acted like she did not care and that they got our money and that was all that mattered. I did not feel welcome and I could not even enjoy the water park although our 5 year old had a good time. In the past we have stayed at Grand Country Hotel and had a good time in their water park. They are not the best people either when it comes to customer service, but at least they are not rude and snarky. My advice to anyone reading this is to stay at a different hotel and just buy the day pass to the Castle Rock water park if you must go there. We had some friend who stayed at the Angel Inn, just a few blocks down the road and said it was great. Live and learn!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, will go again!”
Reviews.Author: pandam1
Reviews.Content: Really had to think about booking this property because of some of the reviews, but with the cost, the indoor waterpark, the other reviews and going the the property website and seeing the pictures I went ahead and booked this property. We stayed in the Atruim Rooms because of the cost difference and was very pleased with the property. Simple, but clean. It had a microwave and refrig in the room. Waterpark was a short walk across the parking lot and the waterpark was very well staffed. My 14 year old loved the waterpark. Staff was helpful and quick to help and property well kept. Went in Sept and was nice, not crowded at the hotel or in Branson. Can't wait to go back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great Road Trip with the grandbabies will do it again SOON!!”
Reviews.Author: nanageorge
Reviews.Content: I wasn't sure I was reading about the same Castle Rock Resort & Water Park that we took our 3 grandchildren to! Our grand-daughter age 15, two grand-sons age 11 & 3 and enjoyed every moment! Don't let the nay-sayers scare you off. We stayed on the 2nd floor, Tower room; Yes, the beds were hard, but sleepable and extremely clean. The boys loved the fact that they had "their own room and TV"! Anything extra that we asked the staff for it seemed they went above and beyond for us, extra towels, cups, blankets (yes we got cold, we must have had an awesome AC); even gave the kids tokens for the game room!! We had our evening meal at the "Grill" and YES that is what it is and what it is advertised as, a "Grill", so no we were not expecting a 4 course meal. We even took "to go" boxes back to the room with us. And trust me the 11 year old can EAT!!! And you really should try their pizza, it is wonderful!! Yes the parking is bad, but it is Branson after all, and Branson was built on HILLS! As for the Water Park, it was amazing! Our 11 year old has a degree of Autism, when his sister informed the life guards of that, they ALL kept a closer eye on him and that means the world to a Nana, trust me!! We even at times left the 2 older ones in the park for about an hour or so and felt totally comfortable about it. I can never tell you how much those 3 days will forever leave a great memory in the minds of our whole family. It was the 3 year olds first "road trip" with Nana & Papa and now he calls Castle Rock our "water home"; we will return and with smiles on our faces!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the stay”
Reviews.Author: familygetaway_10
Reviews.Content: Nothing to complain about as far as the rooms were concerned. Never got any ice from the ice machine. I think there aren't enough ice machines for the number of guests. But other than that, it was a great time for our family. The water park was the highlight for us. Our kids are 4 & 7 yrs. old and both had a blast. We were traveling with friends, their children 3 & 13 yrs. old also enjoyed themselves. As far a the water temp. it was very comfortable during our stay. I hate cold water and won't swim if it is cold and that wasn't a issue.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms but the rest doesn't hold water, unless your a polar bear...”
Reviews.Author: dlaw9737
Reviews.Content: My family went to the hotel/ water park resort for my 6 year olds birthday week-end. The place was pretty pricey per night but it's advertisments were very compelling with it's GUARANTEED 84 DEGREE WATER YEAR AROUND. Upon arrival parking is tedious at best, I do not recommend this point of intrest for the elderly or anyone with a heart condtion, very hilly. The resort had a feeling of being very new or being very close to financial difficulties. They charged for everything that other reorts do not, for example: Refridgerator= $10 daily. There is no ice machines on the floors and no continental breakfast. The resort and rooms although, were very nice and spacious and the beds slept well. The water park itself was very nice and appealing upon first appearance: however; that impression quickly rapidly disappeared when my foot touched the water. The warmest any of the pools were during the weekend we spent there were approximately 78 degrees, and that was the smallest kiddie pool on our last afternoon of our 3 day stay. Previous trips to the pool areas resulted in immediate returns to our room. The water was to cold for even the kids to tolerate, their lips turned blue. The resort personel were uninformative, complacent, aloof, ineffective at best. If the situation was not covered by a set policy they refused or did not know how to respond. Because of the resorts violation of their advertised guarantee of 84 degree water year around and that being the primary reason families would go there in the first place with small children, I would place an intrinsic value of our stay at only half of what we paid... which was $125.00 nightly.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: DnzForce04
Reviews.Content: We recently got back from Castle Rock Resort. Like another traveler on this review board, we stayed at the adjacent hotel atrium, not in the main tower building. We did have to wait until 4 p.m. to check in, which we didn't like, but that wasn't the hotel's fault that we arrived at 10:30 a.m. to Barnson. They did give us our waterpark passes at that time and suggested that we play in the park for awhile. I thought that was very nice. When we did get to our room, which was on the backside of the adjacent building away from the main building, I was pleasantly surprised. It was a very clean room and the air conditioner was very cold, which was great because it was about 100 degrees! We did not, however, have a micro/fridge in our room, which was disappointing. I called the front desk and for $10/day they brought one right to our room within15-20 minutes. I was impressed by that because there was no elevator so the poor maintenance had to carry it up those stairs! The waterpark itself was GREAT for younger children. Our child is only 2.5 years old and he had a BLAST at the waterpark. I do agree that if you have older children, they will get bored because there are only 2 slides and then the lazy river, but I did see a lot of older kids having a good time. The only complaint I would have is that the housekeeping staff did not clean our room one day. I am not sure why other than we were not out of the room when they came by, but we told them we were leaving, but they never came back to clean...they did, however, leave clean towels. I was also impressed with the fact that the owner came by twice to ask us how we liked our stay while we were at the pool...very nice. I would suggest to Castle Rock that a continental breakfast should be offered at no additional charge. I missed that at this hotel and to be more competitive, I think it would be a great thing for them to offer! Overall, I was a little leary after reading all of the negative comments, but after experiencing Castle Rock myself...I feel that we would definitely stay there again and probably will considering I just called another resort that has an indoor park and they were so rude to me on the phone that I will never stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Worst "Resort" for the money, value and quality!”
Reviews.Author: annmarie318
Reviews.Content: My kids and I spent a long weekend at Castle Rock Resort this past weekend. When I called for reservations, the first call told me there was nothing available even though as I sat online it showed rooms available. I decided to call and ask again. This time, I was told that there were rooms available overlooking the waterpark with a king bed and bunk beds. Since I had promised the kids we could stay there, I jumped on it. The room at first glance was nice. But the king bed was extraordinarily hard and the bunk beds just felt like an egg carton pad on a piece of plywood. My son slept there the first night. Started out on top and ended up on the bottom bunk. The next night, he chose the chair in the room. Top off the uncomfortable beds with no a/c. To even get the fan blowing on it, I had to lay down in the floor and stick my finger in a hole in order to get it turned on. Lucky I didn't electrocute myself. Housekeeping only straightened up the bed, not the bunks and did not replenish any of the supplies. If you forgot something, they sold it in their gift shop for ridiculous amounts ($3 for a sample size toothpaste). There was not a breakfast or anything else complimentary as there are in many other hotels in the Branson area. Parking was a nightmare. The lot was small and over flow was in a dark area around to the side. The water park was fairly enjoyable for the kids. They ran up and down going to the slides, but the open slide (you go down without a tube) was dangerous. I went down once and hurt my shoulder. My daughter (15 years old) went down it and bruised her ankle badly. She said that you had no control of yourself whatsoever and she just went flying up over the edges of the slide. The lazy river was fun, but would have been much better had there not been small kids running around without tubes. It was fast moving and hard to stop. You literally had to brace your feet on the bottom to avoid hitting little kids without a tube. This was about it other than some kiddie pools and a joke of a dumping bucket (similar to the ones at the Great Wolf Lodges, but it only filled with about a foot of water and dumped). It was way overpriced and definitely not worth the money. I was strongly disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Don't be fooled by the fake bunkbeds in...”
Reviews.Author: PNiell
Reviews.Content: Don't be fooled by the fake bunkbeds in the picture. My son chose to sleep on the floor instead of this excuse for a bed. You can actually feel the boards just by pressing the bed with ur hand. The doors and the beds squeak. There isn't a vent in the bathroom. We finally lowered the temp on the AC unit to 72 when it kicked in. The thermostat had to be off because we were melting. And as far as advertising that the kids can watch tv from their own bed is crazy. They don't realize the angle is off and it's not a clear picture from the bottom bunk. I'm not a picky person - but this was a lot of money to be such a false representation of what I'm experiencing. Paying for two rooms for two nights. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “HIGHLY OVER RATED_ DO NOT RECOMMEND”
Reviews.Author: skbkjb
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed with this hotel. If you have small children under the age of 7 the waterpark would be great, for older kids they will get bored. It is not near as nice as it appears. The beds are the worst I have slept on in Branson in along time. They are out dated and as hard as a rock. Two people that I was with slept on the floor. The stool in our bathroom was broken. I do have to say the room was very clean, no issues there. There is a restaurant on site that we had breakfast at and it was very good. This is not a motel I would recommend for the price they charge. It is a $50.00 motel not a $150.00 one. I am not a particular person so for me to rate as I have it was not an enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Worried for nothing!”
Reviews.Author: sardiseagles7
Reviews.Content: Based on all the negative reviews for this Resort, I was very skeptical, but decided to try it one time and hope for the best. We just got back from a stay here with our two boys, 2 and 7. We thoroughly enjoyed ourselves, plenty of activities for the kids when you are at not out on the town. The rooms inside the renovated Tower building, with access to the indoor corridors/waterpark were $159, where as the Atrium building, were $109. We normally choose private balcony rooms, but since there were none, we chose a room on the extreme backside, farthest away from the waterpark and still was only about 30 seconds to walk through the parking area to access the outdoor park, which also led right to the inside park. ALL the lifeguards were very attentive, in which based on reviews, I wasn't expecting to see this. They were constantly moving around the vicinity of every slide, nook and cranny checking on every kid and thing going on. When we arrived, I went in, was greeted promptly and asked to see a room, they gave me a key card and I went on my way, when I saw the room was fine, we went and checked in. We chose the Atrium building, which were not as updated as the Tower building, but considering Branson and all the activities, as long as it was clean, we would only need it to sleep. The TV was fine, had plenty of channels and clear. The pools/park was very clean and the chlorine smell was not any different from any other water park I've ever been to, smelled CLEAN, in fact, I'm glad it did smell strong of chlorine, at least I know it was properly maintained for safety standards considering the amount of people visiting.
