If you want a basic room and don't mind a few second walk across their parking lot, the atrium building is fine for the money, considering what you get. I WILL definitely be bringing my family back in August, so much for the kids to do for the money! Thanks Castle Rock!!

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend it to anyone, Worse hotel rooms ever”
Reviews.Author: MLCNixa
Reviews.Content: I would never refer your hotel to anyone. We had stayed there on 03/23/10 and wasted $199.76 on the room. I had contacted customer service by this website before with no response. Our room was gross, there was dirty clothes from prior guest. Someone had wiped snot and blood on the window in our room prior to us checking into it. For the price we spent was outrageous. The waterpark had so much chlorine in the water, that several kids vomited in the water, thus closing that area. The beds were so uncomfortable we ended up getting upset and checking out that night. All was said to us was "oh". This goes down in my book as the lowest hotel ever, worse customer service ever experienced.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: countrylivin84
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Castle Rock while in town for a wedding. The rooms were comfortable and the kids loved the water park. Staff was helpful and congenial. Great location, too! We will definitely stay here on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again for waterpark”
Reviews.Author: m-mumma
Reviews.Content: We went to Branson for Mother's Day weekend. We had 3 rooms, one in the tower and two in the atrium. I will say that the atrium rooms were not as updated as our room in the tower seemed to be. When we arrived on Saturday afternoon, we checked in right away and had no issues. We were given wristbands for the water park. We put our bags in the room and were off to the waterpark. The kids were really excited since you could see it from the elevator lobby on the second floor (where our room was). The water park was good. We have stayed at several of these types of places in the last year and it was about average. My children (4 and 8) were able to use all of the slides and pools. I will say that the lifeguard at the bottom of the tube slide was slightly distracted which made me a bit nervous but I just made sure that I was there if my 4 year old needed assistance, which she didn't. We had to drag our kids out for dinner. I was disappointed that the waterpark closed at 5 on Sunday. We went to Silver Dollar City so we didn't get back until after then. So, we only got to use the waterpark once. One thing I have to say is that they did put the restrooms in a central location in case you need to hop out real quick. The room was decent. It looked remodeled (new carpeting, tile, lighting and fixtures). We had a fridge and a microwave. That was nice. The bunk bed did have extremely small mattresses on them. Kind of like an egg carton mattress covered with a sheet. But my kids were excited to have their "master bedroom" and did not complain. The bedspread on our bed had a stain on the underside of it so we didn't use it. I just put it on the floor and it was replaced with another the next day. They had extra blankets in the drawer which seemed new and were clean. The beds were horrible (hard and loud) like previous people said. There was a shortage of towels and the water was really hard but I do not expect perfection. They do not replenish the toiletries each day. We threw away the soap after using it for one day so we had to request another one. The shower head was low which was tough for anyone over 5 foot 10 inches. The iron and iron board were new. The breakfast buffet was cheap. However, the food was only mediocre. They did have several selections. Overall it was fine. I figured that it wasn't going to be 5 star since I only paid 130/night for the large tower room. I would recommend the extra money to stay in the tower for anyone thinking about the benefits between the two.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT ever stay at this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: RobinCake
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Castle Rock was terrible, and that is being kind! We reserved three rooms, one in the Tower building, two in the adjoining (Atrium) building. Our reservations were made online, plus we called for additional information regarding the water park hours, etc. At no time did any one mention that the kiddie part of the water park was going to be CLOSED on the day of our arrival! We had three small children, under the age of 3, with us that were so excited to be going to the water park. When we checked in, Lynn explained that the kiddie portion of the water park was closed but would be open the next day (Saturday). I explained that we each paid about $130 for our rooms so that our children could enjoy the water park. She was rude, wouldn’t even look at me while speaking to me, and said that the kiddie pools would be open on Saturday. I explained that my youngest daughter and her family had to leave on Saturday she still did not offer a refund and kept her head down as if she was too busy to be bothered with us. I asked when the manager would be in and was told that he would be in on Saturday. Lynn stated that our kids could use the pool. I explained that our children were very little and were too small for the pool. And, that we specifically came to this hotel because of the kiddie pools. Once my youngest daughter and her family went to check out their room, they found that it had not been cleaned. The dirty linens were piled on the floor. We returned to the hotel lobby and they gave them another room. While going to their new room, they saw Lynn on her way (empty handed) to the first room they were sent to. They stopped to see what she was doing in there. After a couple of minutes, she came out (again, empty handed). They went and looked in the window, as she had left the curtains pulled back, and she had put the DIRTY linens back on the bed! YUCK! Our room was a king bed with Jacuzzi. We found rat droppings (Yes, rat turds) in our dresser and in the floor of the room. I would not recommend staying here for any reason!! Saturday morning I went back to the lobby to speak with the manager. Lynn stated that he was not going to be in until Monday. I asked if there was anyone else I could speak to. She went to the back and sent out Cathy who stated she was the “owner”. I explained everything to her and again, was told that there was nothing they could do about it. A few hours later, I received a phone call from Lynn who stated that she was going to give my daughter a 10% discount for their Friday night bill. Wow, $13 really made up for all of that. On Saturday morning we did spend a couple of hours at the water park and yes the kiddie pools were open. The water was freezing and the children could only stay in for a few minutes at a time. All of the doors were propped open because the lifeguards were hot and this made it even colder on the kids. While attempting to use one of the adult slides, I slipped and fell hurting my arm. The lifguard didn't even offer to help me up, or ask if I was OK. This was a nightmare and I'm so thankful it's over. We go to Branson at least once a month and have never had such a terrible experience. Please, do yourself a favor and DO NOT EVER STAY HERE. And, save your friends and family a lot of hassle and tell them about this horrible place.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with our experience at Castle Rock.”
Reviews.Author: TravelingKochs
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at CastleRock for 2 nights with a large group of 20 family members age -1 to 70. Our checkin was handled quickly and courteously by the staff. Our rooms we're typical hotel rooms, very clean- not enough towells for our group- but we we're given all we needed. The reason to stay at this hotel is obviously the water park- and it did not disappoint. There are two large slides, a lazy river (which our entire family loved, it is painted brown to make it look like a river) A kiddie pool area with a couple of waterfalls, 3 small slides, the bucket that spills down and a flower that rains down. There is also a regular swimming pool. The lifeguards are awesome here- mostly highschool looking kids- but obviously trained very well. They we're on top of their job and very professional. Our kids did get the "whistle" a couple of times for running, or hanging on something they weren't supposed to- but the lifeguards handled each situation very well. The water was warm enough and there was enough to keep everyone busy. I saw them checking the chemical levels several times during our trip. None of our kids had red eyes or complained about their eyes hurting because of the chlorine. One night we had pizza in the restaurant downstairs- the pizza was good and the staff was really good, very attentive and helpful. I did give the sleep quality only 3 stars because the pillows aren't great, and the bed is hard and loud. Everytime you turn over you feel like you're gonna wake the rest of the room. We found this to be a great place to stay with kids. If you are staying several nights but only plan to play in the waterpark one day- it would probably be better to stay in a cheaper hotel and just do the day passes. But we used the waterpark everyday. Also the attractions at Branson are almost all around 20 bucks (the ducks, butterfly palace, ripley's) so this was a fun way to play without spending even more money.

Reviews.Title: “Unless they get better beds, we won't stay again.”
Reviews.Author: familyofboysMissouri
Reviews.Content: The ONLY good things about this stay were the indoor waterpark and the location of the hotel, which was close to many other attractions and restaurants in Branson. We stayed in March over Spring Break with our three boys. They love the water and were able to swim and play daily inside. Otherwise, the hotel itself seemed VERY cheap to us, especially since we booked a family "suite" and paid over $200 per night (for four nights.) For that price, we felt the beds/mattresses at least should be much nicer than they were. The children's bunk bed---the bottom bunk---was like literally laying on boards. TERRIBLE!! Our 4-year old could not sleep on it and we didn't force him to because it was so uncomfortable. And the regular beds were not much better. You know it is bad when the pull out sleeper is more comfortable than the beds in the room. We've been alot of places and this by far had the absolute worst beds ever. It would be different if it was cheaply priced, but it isn't. So, unless they upgrade their beds and make the rooms nicer, we won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Do not believe what the website tells you!”
Reviews.Author: FerFer1978
Reviews.Content: We choose this hotel because we have a 6 yr old and a 2 yr old and knew they would love the indoor waterpark advertised on this hotels website. It was 50 degrees outside so we were glad to see that the indoor waterpark maintained 84 degrees year round and thought it would be a fun time for our family. We checked in and the room hadn't been updated since the 1980"s, I'm sure. Fixtures were hanging off the wall (door stop, clothes rack, etc.). We went to the waterpark to find that they were having a problem with their ventalation system so they had the doors and windows open - we only lasted for 30 minutes before our 2 yr old started turning purple because it was so cold in there! It was warmer outside than it was in there. When we complained about it we were just told, I am sorry - they did nothing to try and make our stay more enjoyable nor did they offer a discount or to refund our money. We had to find other things to do to occupy the kids and ended up spending about twice as much as we had anticipated becuase the waterpark was a flop!

Reviews.Title: “Never again please read this review”
Reviews.Author: backseatdriverAR
Reviews.Content: Everything was beautiful until we stepped into the fridgid water at the indoor waterpark. I have two small children and the indoor waterpark was the ONLY reason we decided to stay here..At first glance we were thinking WOW this is going to be WONDERFUL.. so terrible wrong, it was just the opposite. The water and atmosphere was soo chilly that my 3 yr old's chin shivered soo hard that he begged to go back to the room for a hot bath. There is NOT A HOT TUB at all, On the upper level was the two cool slides and the really neat lazy river also EVERY WINDOW was opened and the air was blowing. When we asked why, we got a snappy answer from a cocky "lifegaurd" that is was ventilation control and they get hot. The attendants acted as if they were forced to do community service instead of a paying job. So later that night we decided to try the water park again because that was the reason we paid the pricey amount to stay there, when we arrived we found that not only were the windows still wide open on the upper level, but now they had the 4 sliding glass doors wide open on the lower level.. The only thing that came to my mind was that was just a way to keep people OUT of the waterpark.Make it as miserable as possible. This place was a huge disappointment, we asked for a partical refund and LEFT.. Never to return again.

Reviews.Title: “Manager and policies of this hotel make it a definate "NEVER again"”
Reviews.Author: heatherofcarthage
Reviews.Content: This hotel was terrible. We arrived and checked in before going to a show, we were running late so we did not look in the room. When we got back from the show we went in and sat on the bed. It was hard and felt like a giant spring. It smelled and there was some kind of red stain on the sheets when I pulled back the blanket. The whole room smelled bad and the carpet had not been cleaned in ages. We went to the desk and said we did not like this room and asked for another. The girl at the desk was very rude and not helpful so we asked for a manager. He said his housekeepers were all gone for the day and he would have to charge us for the room whether we stayed there or not it was policy. There was another couple at the desk during this time and they said there was a used condom in their bed and vomit on the bunk bed of the room they were given and the manager had the gall to ignore them and carry on with us. We explained we did not want this nasty room and we would just stay elsewhere. He charged us for the room anyway. On our way out the door we bumped into the housekeeper. I was so surprised I asked him how late he works and he said 8:00PM, it was only 5:00. The manager was not only rude and had terrible customer service but he was also a liar. He said housekeeping was gone for the day. Anyway, long story short this was bad and if I could do it all over I would never had made a reservation in this DUMP. Save yourself and find a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Indoors but cold!”
Reviews.Author: Toothdoc79
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for spring break thinking it would be great for our kids since it was still cold outside and they love to swim. To our dissapointment, though, the enclosed pool area is nowhere near as warm as advertised (in fact, we saw a couple windows open and it was snowing outside) and the pool water is even colder. Our kids could barely stand swimming an hour before their teeth started chattering. We've been to other indoor waterparks and have had a great time because they actually pay to heat the enclosure and water. Although having bunkbeds in the hotel rooms are a great idea, the mattresses were so hard that we couldn't sleep. I'd check out what the other indoor waterparks in Branson have to offer before booking here.

Reviews.Title: “pass on this hotel”
Reviews.Author: dmick007
Reviews.Content: This place does not understand guest service. I can not believe they put this property together to compete in a very competitive Branson market without any thought from the guest perspective. Water park water is frigid, and there is not a hot tub??? The dumping water bucket was broken or off along with lazy river buckets. Breakfast buffet is a joke, filling cereal dispensers with always save cereals in the dining room, staff completely pissed at the lack of help, zero professionalism. The maid service didnt even bother to make up the beds or clean the bathroom. The marketing and the exterior look are beautiful, but the service inside is a miss. Sorry to say, spend your money somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “to pricey!”
Reviews.Author: sekansasgirl
Reviews.Content: was not what we expected, my 4yr old was to small for the slides, my 14yr old go bored of it quickly, grand country was so much better and cheaper... won't ever go back!

Reviews.Title: “One time only....”
Reviews.Author: ou1forthat
Reviews.Content: Hotel was somewhat clean, room was OK but could tell there had been lots of kids thru there with stains on carpet, walls and bedding. VERY cheap built hotel and could hear every noise. Family upstairs were playing romper room at 6:45am and woke us all up. Beds were the WORST I had ever slept on and the kids even complained about the bunk beds..... Water park was OK for entertaining the kids for a couple of hours before they were bored the chlorine was so potent the kids could only swim a few hours at a time before feeling ill. Not a place I will be going back to......

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected...”
Reviews.Author: justalittlecrazykc
Reviews.Content: My wife and son and I stayed here in January, along with my brother & sister-in-law and my niece. Some of our family lives in Branson, and they met the rest of us at the waterpark. My father-in-law set things up and I really wasn't expecting too much, but we wound up with a comfortable room in the "tower" (not sure that I would recommend staying across the parking lot in the non-tower rooms from what I could see.) Really, no complaints. Our room had a little alcove with a bunkbed and its own TV, which my son loved. The waterpark was much better than I had expected and we all had a blast. Outdoor pools were closed, but the indoor waterpark features a couple kiddie pools with animal slides (which my son loved), a mini-dump bucket, a really nice lazy river and a couple of water slides. Plenty to hold our attention for a couple of hours. I probably wouldn't make this a destination resort, but it was a fun, convenient place to meet up with family. The only thing missing: A hot tub. (Even a lukewarm pool would suffice!)

Reviews.Title: “MOST FUN MY KIDS HAVE HAD ON VACATION”
Reviews.Author: jwizzer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Castle Rock for New Years Eve, they had a wonderful family friendly party that we all enjoyed very much. The staff was wonderful and everyone was very accomodating, the bunkbeds for the kids were great they were able to watch cartoons while my wife and I watched the news, what a great idea, the beds were firm which suits me fine as that's what I am accustomed to. My family will definitely be going back for our spring break trip. The kids haven't stopped talking about how much fun they had.

Reviews.Title: “Loved every minute of our stay!”
Reviews.Author: MissPhit
Reviews.Content: We visit Branson a couple times a year and have stayed in many hotels there. Now that we've found Castle Rock, we'll never stay anywhere else! For what it offers, it's the best value in town. The new waterpark is even bigger and better than we expected. The staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful, the entire facility was spotless, and our daughters (8 and 5) had a BLAST! If you've ever stayed at the Grand Country hotel/waterpark in Branson ... it doesn't even compare to Castle Rock. I will definitely recommend this hotel to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “business”
Reviews.Author: tatmaydayoo
Reviews.Content: the young maint guy seemed really professional. the pool looked great everythging was great in my opinion i wilkl be here again..

Reviews.Title: “Would not return”
Reviews.Author: dopey16
Reviews.Content: The beds were uncomfortabe. The staff were not friendly. The front desk called our room twice and told us to be quiet and all were doing was walking in the room after 10:30. There were kids running in the halls and down the stairs case and it wasn't us. Any additional quests staying in room and and you don't have enough wrist bands for the water park they charge you 20.00. To me that is stupid. We stayed there in the summer I was charged to sit out by the pool and I don't even swim or get in the water. The floor is more comfortable than the bunk beds. The restaurant is more like a grill and are over over price . The staff is not friendly. We were at the pool and they ran out of towels. Check in time on Sunday is 4 and the pool closes at 5. The hours for the water park need to be longer since that is why you go there in the first place. I brought 4 gift cards for family over the year I won't do that again. I would go to the other water park it also has hot tubs. We also has scheduled another trip and they canceled it because they had a problem with water when we were. My grandson was itching and had spots on him. They seem not to care.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was good overall. But.... a free continental breakfast would be nice.”
Reviews.Author: ellaspears63
Reviews.Content: Overall service was good. My husband was surprised and not happy that there was not a free continental breakfast. There really should be for the price of the rooms. We felt menu in restaurant (more like a snackbar/cafeteria) was overpriced for what you get. We don't have children and feel like maybe we paid extra for waterpark that we didn't use. Overall wasn't a bad place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “3 Stars for 3 Star Price”
Reviews.Author: BransonVetran
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Castle Rock in Branson with 2 couples and 3 kids 12, 8 and 5 in the Main Building on the 3rd floor. Overall the hotel was clean and reasonably well maintained. The rooms we stayed in where of a suite type with 2 double beds and a kids set of buck beds. The kids bunks were not all that comfortable as they had approximately 2 inches of foam over a a hard base. The double beds where of average comfort. The shower was hot and had sufficient towels. The pool area is a water park with a lap/play pool up to 5 foot depth, 2 slides, a todler zero entry splash pool and a "lazy river". During our stay the lazy river appeared to have a significant algae problem that kept us out. The restaurant appeared to be of average to low quality but we didn't eat in it. For the money you should also consider the Grand Country Inn if you are looking for an indoor water park in Branson, MO. Castle Rock's has 3 advantages over this property. All of the rooms at Castle Rock's Main Building connect indoors to the water park (there are out side buildings as well). This is probably the main advantage depending on the time of year. The rooms in the main building are quite large. The Castle Rock has a dedicated kids sleeping area in its rooms. We have stayed at both properties a couple of times now, so have experience at both. In the end the hotel portion of Castle Rock is probably better then the alternative indoor water parks. The Castle Rock hotel is quiet and the rooms are larger, but there is a better choice when it comes to the water part of a Branson trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great for kids but beds are hard and breakfast stinks!”
Reviews.Author: MOMMYCHELLE
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at Castle Rock last night and we enjoyed it for the most part. The water park was fun for the small kids, but I would say any kids over 9 or 10 wouldn't enjoy it as much. ITt was really nice to see all the life guards. The room was a nice size, and the additional room with the bunk beds were handy. The kids loved having their own flat screen. I wish the air conditioner really meant it when it gave the high, low, auto options. I opted for high, but it stayed on the auto option and kicked off and on all night. My back hurt in the morning from the hard beds! Breakfast this morning was not very good for the money. The biscuits were burnt and the eggs tasted so bad the kids wouldn't even eat them. They advertise a certain price and then added extra for drinks, which added up quickly with four kids. Overall the customer service was good and we would stay there again, but only if we get a discounted rate again.

Reviews.Title: “Its OKAY, really! Dont go by old reviews... LOTS OF FUN!”
Reviews.Author: MissouriBusyMomOfTwo
Reviews.Content: I nearly canceled my reservation after reading all the poor reviews from earlier in the year. I understand that some may have had bad experiences when the hotel first opened, but it seems that all that has been resolved. We arrived in mid-August, and we thought it was a blast. Sure, not a "high end" resort like some may think, but not a low end hotel either. Its somewhere in the middle for "quality." Check in was fine, only 2 behind the desk at the time, and the line grew behind me....but we were pleased they let us check in two hours earlier than check in time. The water park was great, especially for little ones. Outside, a 3' pool, and a 1' wading pool with a couple of nice slides. Lots of area for parents to sit in chairs, chaise loungers, and tables with umbrellas. Inside, 2 other 3' pools, a 7" wading area for itty bitty kids, and another large 1' wading area with three cool slides. Lots of water and sprinklers squirting everywhere. Upstairs was the lazy river, 2' 4" deep. The only issue I had with that is that it went faster than expected for a "lazy" river. The current was fairly fast, and for a beginning swimmer, it may be too much for them without a flotation device or life jacket (of which they had tons for kids to use). My daughter is learning to swim, and at times I felt she might have gone under if she got caught with other people in their rafts, and she was pinched between. Once I saw her hand go up as she went under the water, and the lifeguard jumped up....but her head bobbed up a second later..... I told her to stay away from the rafts, b/c she could get pulled under. Lots of fun though, water everywhere for those who like to get wet! As for the room quality, the vanity was a nice marble, carpet was clean, bathroom was new and clean, beds were clean, the only thing I thought could have been improved was there was no refrigerator or microwave. PROS: lots of lifeguards at the pool, and they werent just sitting around either. Very alert, walking around the entire time, watching the pool. Towels provided, no need to take any. Felt very safe, and we didnt use a locker. Nothing was ever touched. Lots of tables around to sit. Kids loved the pool areas, and our older child liked the water slide. (the other one was not working). Nice and clean rooms, no bugs (like another post mentioned), clean linens, nice TV, cool area for the kids to sleep in the bunk beds..... Another plus for a fussy mom, the public bathroom outside the pool area was clean and nice. Lots of showers for those who stay across the lot in the other hotel. We will visit again. CONS: no continental breakfast... strange that a hotel this nice doesnt have an area for breakfast, but they told me I could get b'fast in the restaurant. We never did visit the restaurant, b/c we had places we wanted to eat off site. Laundry facilities were still not in order as they have on their hotel map. I went to check so I could do a load before leaving, and the hook ups are there, but no machines. I never did ask tho, if there were machines on another floor. I agree the beds are hard as rocks, and creak when you move. I am one tho that travels with ear plugs due to "noises" not heard at my house. So I plug up every time I travel. I couldnt sleep the first night very well due to the mattress, but I was so tired the 2nd nite, I did sleep. Kids will sleep anywhere, so they didnt complain. Another "issue" for me personally, that doesnt affect my family is "noises." I noticed I could hear bratty kids upstairs jumping on the beds and running thru the halls....... didnt notice noise from neighbors on the same hall we were, but upstairs, yes. This could be at any hotel, however. Our only "complaints" were the laundry facility and we had to get our cards recharged the 2nd day. Ive been at other hotels where cards need recharged, so that's no biggie. Considering all the other complaints on this website, ours were very minor. If you're expecting a high end hotel, this is not the place. I put the quality as one you might have at a 2 or 3 star, but still very clean and nice (especially considering the water park connected). I think I would say this only due to the beds......at other hotel chains, they have NICE mattresses & linens. And, they have microwaves and refrigerators. So these amenities for me, mark this hotel a little lower than expected.

Reviews.Title: “Skip this one”
Reviews.Author: caist
Reviews.Content: We had 3 rooms in the "extra" building at this resort. When reserving we opted to save a little money by not staying in the hotel connected to the waterpark. Our assumption was that the walk across the parking lot would be the only difference for the savings. Now, we certainly HOPE that the hotel rooms are in better shape. We had a dead phone line in one room, a dead lamp in another. Even though there were lots of empty rooms, we were placed as far from the parking lot as possible. The room keys had to be "re-keyed" for two of the rooms, even though one key had been laying on the bedside table all day. We were told that the keys were very sensitive to being in pockets and purses-- but laying on a table? And don't start looking for ice. The only ice machine was in yet a third building -- another walk across yet another parking lot. Totally unacceptible. The high-speed internet connect was definitely NOT high-speed. There was barely a wireless connection -- so slow that many websites couldn't make it. The kids loved the waterpark -- the only true bright spot of this visit.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is HORRIBLE!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: cmbair131
Reviews.Content: My famliy and I come to Branson, MO every year at the end of the summer. This time we wanted to stay somewhere new. We choose the Castlerock because of the splash park. We arrived and almost instantly i had a bad feeling. The line at the counter was at least 12 people long, the woman at the front of the line was complaining that the price of her room was different than the price she was quoted. The girl behind the counter was not sympathetic at all and told her that she was welcome to find another hotel if the price was not ok with her. We were ready to be checked in and we were told that we owed 140.00 in addition to the price of the room for the splash park in the hotel. We were told when we made our reservations that the splash park was included in the price, we paid anyway because that was why we stayed there. We were disappointed in the fact that there is NO breakfast offered in the morning, but there is a semi-acceptable resturant in the hotel where you can buy your breakfast. I think for 130.00 a night i should at least get a contenential breakfast, we were told they offered breakfast but the front desk did not mention that it was not part of the hotel price. The staff was rude when we asked for additional towels. This hotel is not worth the money. The water in the pools had way toooo much chemicals added and it made my youngest daughter sick. The general manager did not ssem to care when i told her about it and when i asked her for her bosses number she replied that it was her dad. Apparently the hotel is owned by her parents, if i wanted a snotty hotel heiress to be rude to me then i would have stayed at the HILTON. At least i would of gotten a hot breakfast, clean towels, and a nice staff.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: Nurseaggie
Reviews.Content: First of all, they charge extra for the water park, which is located on the property.....but no one even checks for the wrist bands once in the waterpark.... so you pay $30 more per night than if booked with waterpark access and you could still get in free. The restaurant there is not really a restaurant, more like a snack/ fast food place. Beds were tooooo soft, couldn't sleep well. And they do have fridges and microwave for an additional fee, unless you have a disability- then you get them free. Clean room, but will stay elsewhere next time we travel to Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Burning eyes and bugs!!!”
Reviews.Author: calebnconnorsmom
Reviews.Content: Our first impression of this hotel was very good at first. We stayed in the new main building with the waterpark. My two boys, 5 & 7 loved their bunk bed with their own TV. I was impressed that the rooms were newer and clean. We went to the waterpark which the boys loved. The lazy river looked dirty - kinda like river water - I got in and got splashed and it felt like my eyes were disenegrating - the chlorine was so strong!!!! I immediatley had to get out and find a towel. I don't know how my boys were able to stand it - they did the waterslides for a couple of hours. I just sat and watched with my eyes burning still. That night my poor 5yr olds eyes were all bloodshot and looked like he got punched in both eyes. They had dark circles underthem and were all puffy. Then we went back to our room and I seen these weird bugs crawling on the wall in the boys bunk den. I've never seen bugs like this before-freaked me out when I went to kill them and they moved REAL fast. I killed 3 of them - then in the morning when I was taking a shower I seen 3 more!! Also, other reviews stated there was free breakfast-fruit, bagels, yogurt, etc. The night before I had asked someone where that was, and they said the continental breakfast was in the restaurant. My husband got up early and went down to get something to eat. He asked someone again and they also told him it was in the restaurant. When he went to check it out, they were hateful with him and said they quit that a week ago - It would be nice if they would update the other workers so they are not telling guests there is breakfast. The workers attitude about it really pissed off my husband - in the meantime I was freaking out about the bugs because I seen MORE. We decided then, after seeing my 5 yr olds eyes still red that we would not be staying another night. When I went to tell the front desk I spoke to a manager and told her about the bug situation. She said they spray everyday because of the waterpark and it was probably just waterbugs. Acted like it was no big deal. She did immediatly send mainteneace up, and I showed him the bugs (I noticed even more hiding up in the corners and creases of the walls) He said he would be right back to spray - I told him to just wait until we were gone because we were leaving right away. Also, the waterpark does have a lot of lifeguards on duty -which are all teenagers. I wasn't impressed that they blew the wistle on my 5yr old for running (kids get excited), but then they can goof off and flirt with each other by throwing cups of water at each other and one even ran up to the girl he was changing shifts with and knocked her in the water!!! - don't blow the wistle on my kid, then do something that would have gotten anyone else in trouble!!!

Reviews.Title: “Overall, very good, we would stay again”
Reviews.Author: FtSmithDad
Reviews.Content: I read some of the reviews on here and to be honest, I was a little skeptical about booking our stay at Castle Rock. But I got the impression the bad reviews were from people who stayed in the old Atrium building. So I thought what the heck, we will give it a try. We stayed July 3-5th in the new Tower building. The room was clean. It is your typical motel room so don't expect anyting too fancy. The kids bunkbed room was very handy and my kids enjoyed having their own TV. The only downside to the room was that I requested a fridge for the kids drinks but they did not have one available. Luckily I planned for that and brought a cooler and just kept filling it up with ice from the ice machine that was on our floor (3rd floor has the ice machine). The other issue we had was our room had no wash cloths, only large towels. I called the front desk around 9 pm to ask for some. At 10 pm I still did not have any, so I went down to the front desk and there was a young girl working and she said she still had it written down but she was the only one working so she could not leave the desk. She was waiting for the maintenence man to come back from the other building to run them up to me. So I just took them myself. No big deal but a little frustrating. They were understaffed for a holiday weekend. The water park was great. It is good for young kids. Older kids and adults won't get much out of it. My kids are 6 and 3 and they had a blast. There were a lot of lifeguards on duty, all teenagers of course. All the pools and rides were working and it was clean. They do have some strict rules, like no outside floateys or pool toys, etc that seemed a bit strange. But all and all, it was much better than I expected and we would go there again. Just make sure you stay in the Tower Bldg. Also, the restuarant opened the day we checked in. We did not eat at it but it looked clean and nice. With some time to get an experienced staff, I think it will be a good place to stay with the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Kids Loved the WaterPark, Rooms Great everything else (well what can I say)?”
Reviews.Author: vacationerfsm
Reviews.Content: WaterPark was great Kids cried wanting to swim more. Waterpark has lots of Lifeguards that wat nice. Toured May 2009, Made reservations May 2009 for July 1 - July 5. July 1 got room and waterpark bands (did not get our tickets for package until next day late). July 2 Housekeeping cleaned room, July 3 Housekeeping emptied trash and fresh towels, next 2 days housekeeping didn't touch our room. (had to empty our own trash & get our own towels). Talked to 4 different managers to try to get our 3 different invoices with 3 different amounts corrected. (we'll have to wait and see what comes in on our credit card) Manager told us I will see what I can do about bill and get you some stay vouchers to give them a second chance, (well bill was not changed from the last one and now vouchers)..... Not a good experience for us.

Reviews.Title: “Had A Great Time! Will Be Staying Here Again!”
Reviews.Author: ForgivenTOO
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews AFTER I had already booked my reservation I was a little nervous about our stay. IT WAS GREAT! We had a nice, clean, room with a refrigerator, microwave, blow dryer, iron, ironing board, coffee maker, coffee, and a jet tub. The water park was great! The life guards do a really good job. The staff was friendly and we met a lot of nice people there. The restaurant wasn't open yet, which we didn't mind. The breakfast was "OK" muffins, donuts, bagels, fruit, cereal, milk, juice, and waffles. There is no hot tub. But the water park makes up for that. We will definetly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Stay in Branson With the Kids”
Reviews.Author: gdsscampbell123
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night and had the best time! We were greeted with kind employees at the front desk who informed us of all the amentites. Are room was excellent. it was clean and stocked with towels etc...We traveled with 2 children, 10 yr and 17 yr old. the water park was very relaxing...especially enjoyed the lazy river and water slide. Lots of towels to dry you off when your done swimming. Lots of seats to watch the kids. Quiet night atmosphere, unlike the loud strip noise if you stay on hwy 76. Nice, well stocked contenental breakfast in clean restaurant atmosphere. They even had a scavenger hunt plus other resort activities for more fun. Overall, I would stay again especially if you have small kids. We went minature golfing with gocarts which is right next door within walking distance. we never left the hotel except to eat dinner. buffet is right up the street also within walking distance. I cant wait to go back! My teenager loved sleeping on the bunkbeds with her own TV. I highly recommend and is in a great location. Way to Go Castle Rock! Loved your hotel! I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to take kids!”
Reviews.Author: jeffreydan32
Reviews.Content: I have a summer basketball team with 11 players. We took our team to Branson for a tournament and wanted them to have some fun other than basketball. We chose Castle Rock for the indoor waterpark. After reading some reviews on here I was kind of scared of what I might find when we got there. We got there and checked in very quick and the people at the front desk were great. They gave us extra passes to the waterpark to cover the parents that brought other kids with them. Everytime we needed something they were very quick to help us. This was just a great place for us this past weekend. We had games on Sunday that lasted until after 3:00. The manager was very nice and gave all 5 of our rooms late check outs at no extra charge.

Reviews.Title: “Kids loved it...Parents survived it!”
Reviews.Author: christnme
Reviews.Content: The kids loved the waterpark...even my husband and I enjoyed it for several hours. There is two slides, a lazy river, two kiddi/toddler areas, two pools (one outdoor, one indoor). Lots of lifeguards on duty, which we really liked! The only downfall to the waterpark is our daughters eyes were very swollen the next day we couldn't even go back into it. The King size room w/ bunkbeds in the Tower part of the hotel was very clean. The kids loved having their own area with bunkbeds. My husband loved the plasma t.v. I liked how clean the room was with a vanity outside the bathroom. Now for the negative...the bed is extremly firm. I told my husband it felt like they throw a sheet over a peice of plywood. Also the air unit had no control to keep the fan running so all night long it kicked on and off and on and off and on and off...for a light sleeper like myself it made for long sleepless night. Another issue I have is I asked for the bill to be put on our credit card which we were told it had been and was even printed a receipt. After checking for several days and finding no transaction on our credit card I checked my debit card and there it was taken out of my checking account. Had we not had a little cushion money in there we would have overdrawn without any notice from the hotel of this transaction. Keep this in mind when you are paying!! Also upon reservation we were not told the resturant was not open yet, which we found out after checking in. I believe this should be disclosed on their website.

Reviews.Title: “Kids had a blast!”
Reviews.Author: Beamzy
Reviews.Content: My family just got home from a 4 night 5 day stay in Branson. For the first 3 nights we stayed elsewhere with friends. The last night we stayed at Castle Rock. From the minute we entered the hotel room the kids wanted to know "Why didn't we stay here the whole time?!" They loved the water park & their bunkbed cave w/tv. Our visit was short, but pleasant. Plenty of friendly lifeguards on duty who made sure the kids followed the rules for their safety. I also saw a hotel employee checking the water for proper chemical levels. Our room was spacious, clean and comfortable. Including a fridge, microwave, coffee pot, hair dryer, iron & board...everything! We had no problems during our stay at Castle Rock.

Reviews.Title: “Negative Comments!”
Reviews.Author: wildernesstrail1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are of the opinion that if you don't have anything good to say, don't say anything at all. However, in this case, I must make an acception. I could write pages about our experience, but I won't.. I will say this. In sixteen years of traveling with our children, this experience was, by far, our worst ever. I would not recommend this property to anyone at any price. If your reading this. Please, don't make our mistake!Read the rest of the reviews before making a decision to say here. Sure wish we had!

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: pinky2000
Reviews.Content: We found a new place to stay when visiting Branson. This is a new hotel with an indoor waterpark. The hotel was very clean and the waterpark is lots of fun. They have 2 big slides and very big lazy river. We will definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “The Kids Loved the Water Park.....Rooms Were OK.”
Reviews.Author: ljx4brats
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here for the weekend. We were in town for a cheerleading competition and thought that the waterpark would be great for the kids. Most of our cheer squad stayed here as well. The kids absolutely loved the water park....they stayed in there for hours!!! The lifeguards were great.....I love the fact that I didn't feel like I had to be right by my kid's side when they were playing. There were more than enough life guards and they were very attentive and very friendly. They also had a few little activities for the kids in the later part of the day, which was very nice. The rooms were ok. The kids loved the bunkbeds!!! The only negative on that is that we couldn't hear our TV over there TV and vice versa. The bunk beds had a very thin mattress, but the kids didn't complain. The beds for the adults however were terrible!!! They were very uncomfortable and very small. I thought I was getting a queen bed, but it was a full bed. The breakfast wasn't what I expected. They just had bagels, cereal, danishes, bananas and apples. I was hoping for a waffle maker or biscuts and gravy or something hot that we could eat. The restraunt in the hotel was not open yet, but when it is open it will be a nice touch. The staff was friendly.....not overly friendly, but ok. There was one staff member that was very rude to my daughters when they went to ask for towels. We went down to address the situation and she had stepped away from the front desk, but someone else behind the desk apologized to us and said she was just a "grumpy" person. In my opinion, a "grumpy" person should not be working in a place where customer service is important......and they especially shouldn't be working the late shift. I would stay at this resort again, just because the kids loved playing in the water park, but I still believe that the cost is a little pricey. One other thing....they definately need some type of steps going from the lower parking lot up to the hotel door.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: rileezmom
Reviews.Content: So I made my reservation back in March to stay at the Castle Rock Resort for my son's birthday. He invited 3 friends to come along and we reserved the room with bunk beds that would hold all 6 of us. The 4 boys were sooo excited! It's a new water park in Branson (oh yes, we are locals too) and none of them have been there. Well, I found out yesterday that the hotel never made my reservation despite my confirmation letter and now the hotel is booked up. I now have to tell 4 young boys that there will be no trip to Castle Rock Resort. Also, the manager was supposed to call me back and never has. Don't get your hopes up to stay at this water park because the staff is too incompetent to make your reservation. So be prepared!

Reviews.Title: “First Time to Branson, Probably Last Time”
Reviews.Author: scottrenee
Reviews.Content: We checked in late to this hotel after having to move from another condo. Very impolite clerk and charged our credit card when told it would not be charged, because the stay was already paid for weeks in advance. Poor Service and always acting like you were bothering them. Staff Very unfriendly. We was suppose to have a room in the tower (family suite) instead got stuck in the atrium in two seperate rooms, had to ask for towels, iron and blow dryer. Poor breakfast variety. Got the stare down every time you entered the building.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, enjoyed our stay as a church group.”
Reviews.Author: KT09
Reviews.Content: From the very first time I spoke to Jerry who booked our groups reservations until the night we stayed, my experience was very pleasant. Jerry was very helpful in making the arrangements to fit our needs as a group and offered special attention to making our stay at Castle Rock fantastic. The restaurant was still closed at the time of our stay but they accomodated our needs for feeding the kids without having to leave the hotel. All of the staff was very helpful and friendly. We stayed in the main building, which is attached to the waterpark, everything was new, clean and decorated very nice. Our rooms had the 2 double beds and a set of bunks in a small room with a flat screen tv. The kids loved the bunk rooms! The waterpark was so much fun. Our kids and adults :O) really enjoyed all that was to offer. I would recommend this resort and waterpark, we were very satisfied!

Reviews.Title: “We may not be ready, but we're still going to charge full price.”
Reviews.Author: GoatHeadband
Reviews.Content: The Bad: -Check in was slow. One person was at the desk and had to keep answering phones. Several manager types sat at a nearby table as the line got longer oblivious to what was going on. When it was finally my turn the clerk disappeared for 2 minutes without saying "excuse me" or "I'll be right back" or anything. This got us off on the wrong foot. -Advertised restaurant was not open yet. -Arcade room was empty. -I didn't realize their was a breakfast until the last day. There are no signs or brochures about it. -The room did not have anything that told you about the hotel or a map or anything. -The stuff on the walls (I'm missing the word for this) comes off very easily. -The phone was not connected to the wall. The cord was still wrapped up like someone just took it out of the package and set it on the table. -We decided to take the stairs that were near our room down to the waterpark instead of the elevators which were far away. Big mistake. We assumed this being a hotel that the stairs were inside. Well they were surrounded by concrete walls, but as soon as the door closed I realized something was not right, but the door had already locked behind us. We went down the very cold stairs and at the bottom it was open. It appears the stairs will be to the outdoor waterpark (when it opens). But there were no signs anything. There was no way back into the hotel at the bottom. Only a locked door to the waterpark and the open parking lot. After shivering and banging on the door for awhile a lifeguard let us in. This was a nice embarrassing way to start our stay. -The entrance is a long way from the parking lot. It got really crowded around the front entrance during heavy checkout/in times. -The elevators were busy and slower than any I have ever been on. -There seemed to be a lot of managers milling around doing nothing important. -The mattress was very uncomfortable and sort of popped like the side of a plastic trash can when you push in on the side and then let go. -No one told us nor was it written anywhere that we were supposed to leave our wristbands on for the waterpark for our second day. When I asked the front desk clerk for wristbands she informed me that we were supposed to leave them on, but she did give us some more telling us like a third grade teacher that she would make an exception for us this time. -I don't want to sleep with a wristband on. -The space for washers and dryers had no washers and dryers on any floor. -No hot tubs!!! The Good: -The lifeguards were very aware and friendly (much friendlier than their older, bitter managers). -My 5 year old loved the lazy river and the slides were fun. -The flat screen televisions were nice. I realize there are always kinks to work out on any new adventure, but you need to have your hotel ready before you open it to people (unless you specify what parts are not yet ready before people arrive). Hopefully they get some of this worked out as time goes. But the next time I am in Branson my family will stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Not for the money”
Reviews.Author: cvaughan
Reviews.Content: We booked our room from thier website. We did take a tower room since the price was a little better. The site for them leads you to believe that the rooms are just the same, but just not in the main building. We were hoping for a very good weekend for just our 10 year old son and us. When we checked in they gave us the keys and we proceeded to our room. What a nightmare those tower rooms are. Those tower rooms are a old hotel that they bought and never did anything with. We called the front desk and my husband spoke with one of the managers. We explained that their website was very misleading and we wanted a different room. He then told him that they were working on updating their website as we speak. My husband told him that we booked our room way before he started ""UPDATING" his website. He told us more less there wasn't anything he could do. I went over to the desk and told them we would like to check out. She ended up giving us a room in the main building with two queens and bunk beds. Rooms were ok. Much better than the TOWER rooms. You do not get what you pay for at this hotel. This is not a resort. The resturaunt was closed. The breakfast they offered was extremely basic. The game room consisted of 4 video games. Most of the front office staff was very rude including the managers. The water park is in comparison to the other indoor water park in Branson. It is nice here that only hotel guests can go. It was not over crowded like the other one. The pool staff was very friendly. I would say do some price negotiations if you should stay here. Do not stay in the tower rooms unless you are wanting a motel instead of a hotel. I will give cudos on the water park and the main rooms are descent. Service is not good!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible; managers are rude and not helpful, especially MICHEAL!!!”
Reviews.Author: zachattack2101
Reviews.Content: I do not recommend anyone staying at this place they call a resort. The restaurant was not open and on the website the do not mention this, nor did they when I called to book the reservations. One slide was broken; but the water part was enjoyable to my 8 year old and 3 year old and the lifeguards were very nice. Now the manager of the resort Michael is a total different story! He is one of the rudest mangagers I think I have ever had to deal with. I checked into the hotel on Monday and checked out on Wed. I paid cash for my stay; but the hotel also charged my credit card not once but twice for my stay. A $323.60 stay ended up costing over $1200.00; when I contacted Michael to get the charges removed he was friendly at first and got 2 of the charges off. So after 48 hours 2 charges were still on my account; once again I contacted Michael; he told me once again he was working on this, after a few words he informed me if I was not nicer it would take a little longer than usual for the charges to get removed from my account, he was not concerned that I was calling the Better Business Bureau or my bank on the fraudulent charges. He also would not let me talk with his superior and hung up on me. Luckily the bank removed the chargers since I have my receipt showing I paid cash and I am contacting the Better Business Bureau. I would not recommend anyone to stay at this resort; newer is not always better.

Reviews.Title: “Needed more time before opening”
Reviews.Author: kimmy43
Reviews.Content: We purchased 2 Wet and Wilder Weekender Packages for our two families after looking at the hotel website. The front desk was very busy when we checked in at 2 p.m. with only 3 clerks working with 3 to 5 people in each line so it took about 30 minutes to check in. The desk clerks would also be answering the phone to take new reservations and provide information while checking people in. The package included 2 nights in a room with 2 double beds and 2 bunkbeds, water park passes for 4, breakfast for 4 each day, $30 restaurant credit which was changed to a gift shop credit because the restaurant is not open yet, and a small tote bag with 4 20oz. soft drinks and 4 single serve bags of chips. The hotel rooms are large with a flat screen tv in the main room with the 2 double beds and one in the bunkbed alcove. There is no door on the alcove so it is not a true separate room in my opinion. There is a blanket and flat sheet folded on the end of each bunk bed. I was glad to find that they did use fitted sheets and a mattress protector on the double beds. Mattresses were firm. We had brought food for snacks and lunches to cut down on meal expenses but unfortunately the micro/fridge that was mentioned on the website was no where to be found. The front desk said they were backordered but would try to get us one from the hotel next door. It never arrived. Toliet paper holder in bathroom was already coming off the wall. Air conditioning was not calibrated to temperature programmed into unit. It seemed to run on its own schedule. Breakfast was offered in the banquet room with large tables so you had to share tablespace with others. Food available was several types of single serve cereal, apples, bananas one day and canned peaches one day, danishes, donuts, milk, orange juice, coffee, and water all of which appeared to have been purchased from a warehouse club type store. Not worth the room charge in my opinion. The water park is very nice and the room was warm. There is only one true swimming pool and it is medium in size and crowded at times. 2 little kids wading pools with small slides and play areas. A plunge pool for the slide. There are two slides but one isn't in operation yet. Upstairs, there is the lazy river which has a sand bottom and a choice of single or double float rings. There is also an outdoor pool play area that they are still building. There are no hot tubs. We talked with one of the lifeguards and he said this was the most common compliant. The area is well staffed with lifeguards and they were quick to respond with swimmers that demonstrated even the slightest difficulty in the water. They were also quick to clean up any standing water and quickly cleaned up when a child hit his mouth on the side of one of the pools and bled a small amount. The hotel should have completed everything before opening or at least noted in its website what was not open or available.

Reviews.Title: “Seperate room 4 bunks, lots of lifeguards 4 indoor waterpark, free brkfst”
Reviews.Author: Gipsee
Reviews.Content: They just opened, so I know they are working out the kinks, I gave less of a rating on service and rooms. The service checking in and out was slow as staff tried to figure out how to do it...it's new and so are they. The rooms were great with a seperate bunk area for the kids with their own t.v. and remote but I wished their was more of a fan in the bathroom and a minifridge/micro. As this place had just opened, the ice machine wasn't in place on our floor yet and the laundry wasn't ready, which we really needed for our bathing suits - for more trips to their awesome indoor waterpark. We could have set them by our wall unit to dry. There were lifeguards everywhere monitoring the pool areas, slides, lazy river and toddler areas - they really paid attention. I would like to suggest they put down slip resistant strips on the tile from the pool area to the elevators as it stayed wet with all the traffic. Overall it was soooo much fun, the kids and I both loved the bunk bed area with private t.v., and we all had lots of fun at the indoor waterpark over and over during our stay. We will definetly go back!

Reviews.Title: “What a joke.”
Reviews.Author: J0018746
Reviews.Content: I choose Castle Rock Resort And Water Park because I knew it was new and had a water park for my 5 year old son. So we planned a weekend trip. I used the website to make all reservations (big mistake), but I knew it was new so what could go wrong. When we arrived a 9pm Thursday night they informed us the hotel was full we would be in the ajacement builting 3 parking lots over from the waterpark. In the Autrium hotel this hotel had to be about 30 years old it smell, it was dirt, and the beds are like rocks. So we check out the next morning we did get use of the waterpark until 9pm the next day. But that was a big let down to, l never seen the arcade and most of the waterpark wasn't working. I know I will never go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience but not great”
Reviews.Author: clsiniowa
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was a little pricy for what they had to offer. The restuarant wasn't opened yet, game room? not sure it existed. The so called continental breakfast has a lot to be desired. The staff was very nice and helpful for a first stay. The kids did enjoy the waterpark but for the price, they should either offer tickets to a show or lower the price. We stayed in the atrium section and they do need to update the rooms. The shower only spit a little water - not much pressure. I would more than like choose another hotel on my next stay.

HotelInfo.Name: Castle Rock Resort & Waterpark
HotelInfo.Address: 3001 Green Mountain Drive, Branson, MO 65616
